coelectus: <entryFree id="n8855" type="main" key="co^e_lectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ēlectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>eligo</etym>, <sense id="n8855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">elected together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 5, 13.</sense></entryFree>
coelementatus: <entryFree id="n8856" type="hapax" key="co^e^le^menta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ĕlĕmentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>elementum</etym>, <sense id="n8856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">composed of elements</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coeles: <entryFree id="n8857" type="main" key="coeles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coeles, coelestīni</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coelestis</orth>, v. cael-.</entryFree>
coeliacus: <entryFree id="n8858" type="greek" key="coeli^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coelĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">koiliako/s</foreign>. <sense id="n8858.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Relating to the abdomen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the stomach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <trans><tr>pain in the stomach</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 125</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 12</bibl>, written as Greek).— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">coelĭăca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. medicina), <hi rend="ital">stomach remedy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 201</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8858.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Afflicted with a disease of the bowels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 22</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one diseased in the bowels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 53, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:201" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 18, 76, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:204" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 14, 58, § 204</bibl>; 30, 7, 19, § 58; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 95 al" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 95 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
coelicola: <entryFree id="n8859" type="main" key="coeli^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coelĭcŏla, coelĭcŭlus, coelĭcus, coelĭfer, coelĭgĕnus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coelĭlŏquus</orth>, etc., v. cael-.</entryFree>
coelioticus: <entryFree id="n8860" type="greek" key="coeli^o_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coelĭōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">koiliwtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleansing the stomach</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bowels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coelius: <entryFree id="n8861" type="main" key="Coeli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Coelĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Caelius.</entryFree>
coemendatus: <entryFree id="n8862" type="main" key="co^e_menda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ēmendātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [emendo], <sense id="n8862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amended at the same time</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
coemesis: <entryFree id="n8863" type="greek" key="coeme_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coemēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koi/mhsis</foreign>, <sense id="n8863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a somniferous song</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, p. 335</bibl> (by Kopp, § 996, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
coemeterium: <entryFree id="n8864" type="greek" key="coeme_te_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coemētērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koimhth/rion</foreign> (a sleeping - chamber; hence), <sense id="n8864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a churchyard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cemetery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burying-ground</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 51 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
coemo: <entryFree id="n8865" type="main" key="co^e^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ĕmo</orth>, <itype>ēmi, emptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (cf. the contracted form, 1. como), <sense id="n8865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to purchase together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to buy up</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59, § 133</bibl>; Cassius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 16 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coemptarum rerum pretia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:293" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 293</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coemptio: <entryFree id="n8866" type="main" key="co^empti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏëmptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coëmo</etym>, jurid. t. t. <sense id="n8866.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pretended purchase of an estate which was subjected to a mock sale for the purpose of divesting it of the burden of certain sacrifices<cb n="COEO" />  attached to it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl> Moeb.— </sense><sense id="n8866.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a marriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting in a mutual mock sale of the parties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which the wife was freed from the</hi> tutela legitima <hi rend="ital">and the family</hi> sacra, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 113</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 237</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 43</bibl>; cf. id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 531, 10 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 103</bibl> (but acc. to Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1061</bibl> = 2. comptus, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
coemptionalis: <entryFree id="n8867" type="main" key="co^emptio_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏëmptiōnālis</orth> (in MSS. also contracted <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmptiōnālis</orth>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 135</bibl>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coëmptio</etym>, <sense id="n8867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a sham sale</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a sham marriage</hi>: senex, <hi rend="ital">who was made use of in such a performance</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">accordingly,</quote> <trans><tr>poor</tr>, <tr>worthless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 52</bibl></cit>.—Of a low kind of slaves, Cur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 29, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coemptionator: <entryFree id="n8868" type="main" key="co^empti^o_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏëmptĭōnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>; jurid. t. t., <sense id="n8868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who enters into the</hi> coemptio, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 115 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Sent. 11, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
coemptor: <entryFree id="n8869" type="main" key="co^emptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏëmptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>coëmo</etym>, <sense id="n8869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who purchases many things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buys up;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">testium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 321, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coemptus: <entryFree id="n8870" type="main" key="co^emptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏëmptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from coëmo.</entryFree>
coena: <entryFree id="n8871" type="main" key="coena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coena</orth>, v. cena.</entryFree>
coenacularius: <entryFree id="n8872" type="main" key="coena_cu^la_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coenācŭlārius</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coenācŭlum</orth>, v. cenac-.</entryFree>
coenaticus: <entryFree id="n8873" type="main" key="coena_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coenātĭcus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coenātio</orth>, etc., v. cen-.</entryFree>
coenito: <entryFree id="n8874" type="main" key="coeni^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coenĭto</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coeno</orth>, v. cen-.</entryFree>
coenobita: <entryFree id="n8875" type="main" key="coeno^bi_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coenŏbīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>coenobium</etym>, <sense id="n8875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cloister-brother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a monk</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl>, n. 34 al.</sense></entryFree>
coenobium: <entryFree id="n8876" type="greek" key="coeno^bi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coenŏbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koino/bion</foreign>, <sense id="n8876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cloister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl>, n. 36 al.</sense></entryFree>
coenomyia: <entryFree id="n8877" type="greek" key="coeno^myia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coenŏmyia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koino/muia</foreign>, <sense id="n8877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the common fly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:104:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 104, 31 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 106 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
coenon: <entryFree id="n8878" type="greek" key="coenon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coenon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koino/n</foreign>, <sense id="n8878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eyesalve</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4234</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coenositas: <entryFree id="n8879" type="main" key="coeno_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coenōsĭtas</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coenōsus</orth>, v. caen-.</entryFree>
coenula: <entryFree id="n8880" type="main" key="coenu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coenŭla</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coenŭlentus</orth>, v. cen-.</entryFree>
coenum: <entryFree id="n8881" type="main" key="coenum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coenum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. caenum.</entryFree>
coeo: <entryFree id="n8882" type="main" key="co^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ĕo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii</itype> (e. g. coierunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 22</bibl>: <sense id="n8882.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">coiere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 452</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 24, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:83 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 83 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cŏĭisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 15, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:94" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:35" default="NO">5, 11, 35</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">pedants preferred conire to coire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 69</bibl>, and Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 137</bibl>), <itype>ĭtum, īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n8882.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assemble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect together</hi> (so mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ad aliquem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in locum</hi>, more rar. <hi rend="ital">in loco</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronae ad Veturiam Volumniamque frequentes coëunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in porticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad solitum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: Pharsaliam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (sc. in sedilia theatri) populus coibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in regiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quem (locum) coibatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aram ejus dei in cujus templo coiretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rege in insulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:101:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 101, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:7:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia crabronum coeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:753" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 753</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 7, 123</bibl> Loers.: <cit><quote lang="la">coivere amicis animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:12:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 12, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:3:6" default="NO">10, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina coibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:9:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 9, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8882.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix memini nobis verba coisse decem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have passed between us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 15, 8.— </sense><sense id="n8882.3" n="B" level="2"> Specif., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come together in a hostile manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to encounter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se coiisse viros et cernere ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 709</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 236</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 225</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:635" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 635</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:16:408" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 16, 408</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8882.4" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to form a whole by coming together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be united into a whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combine</hi> (the usu. class. signif.); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, or <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n8882.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8882.6" n="1" level="3"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">neque se conglobandi coëundique in unum datur spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 801</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 410</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vaga illa multitudo coiret in populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui una coierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqui (milites) coëunt inter se,</quote> <trans><tr>assemble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 75</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in formam justi exercitūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:61:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 61, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut coëat par Jungaturque pari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8882.7" n="b" level="4"> Of the coition of the sexes (both of men and animals), <hi rend="ital">to copulate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1055" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1055</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 744</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alienā uxore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coisse eam cum viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominum cum ancillā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hospitibus stupro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:37 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 37 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privigno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul binis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 17:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic et aves coëunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 733</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 324</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 615</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:193 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 193 al.</bibl>; cf., of marriage, <pb n="359" /> <cb n="COEP" /> </sense><sense id="n8882.8" n="B. b." level="1"> infra.—</sense><sense id="n8882.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: membra. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 377</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 96</bibl>: ignes coire globum quasi in unum, <hi rend="ital">roll together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as into a ball</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 665</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 563</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguenque creari Sanguinis inter se multis coëuntibu' guttis,</quote> <trans><tr>out of many little drops running together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 838</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut coëat lac,</quote> <trans><tr>to curdle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bitumen spissatur et in densitatem coit,</quote> <trans><tr>thickens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 178</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidus coit formidine sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 395</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 770</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:190" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:425" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 425</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum digiti coëunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 670</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cornua tota coirent Efficerentque orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 179</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:860" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 860</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpebrae dormientis non coëunt,</quote> <trans><tr>do not close</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labris coëuntibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 45</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">perfectum quiddam fieri, cum omnia coierunt, necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:9" default="NO">9, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:2" default="NO">2, 19, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae littera cum quāque optime coëat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut placidis coëant immitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 12</bibl></cit>.—Of wounds, <hi rend="ital">to close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arteria incisa neque coit neque sanescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">potest os coire et vulnus sanescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 93, § 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 24, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 9</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">an male sarta Gratia nequicquam coit et rescinditur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n8882.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to unite for some object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclusions</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to join together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assimilate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ally one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar cum eo coire per Arrium cogitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc tu coire ausus es, ut ... addiceres, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 18, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes, quitum unā coierunt, quantum visum est agri adtribuunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: heri aliquot adulescentuli coimus in Piraeo (Piraeum ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 1</bibl> (consensimus ac pepigimus, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">duodecim adulescentuli coierunt ex his, qui exsilio erant multati, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>conspired together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed neque cum quoquam de eā re collocuturum neque coiturum: sic, ille consensionis globus hujus unius dissensione disjectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patricii coiere et interregem creavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos est regibus, quotiens in societatem coëant, implicare dextras, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 47</bibl></cit>; hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">coëant in foedera dextrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 292</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nullius non facinoris societatem coibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl></cit>; and, like this, with changed construction.—</sense><sense id="n8882.11" n="b" level="4"> Esp. of the marriage contract (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">taedae quoque jure coissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:134" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 134</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hac gener atque socer coëant mercede suorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the marriage of Æneas with Lavinia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 317</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8882.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: coire societatem (<hi rend="ital">cum aliquo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to enter into an alliance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a compact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form a league</hi> (with some one; <cit><quote lang="la">several times in Cic.): utinam, Pompei, cum Caesare societatem aut numquam coisses aut numquam diremisses!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de municipis fortunis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:65:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 65, § 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui societatem in tempus coiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:65:section=6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 17, 2, 65, § 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8882.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam rem societas coitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad coëundam societatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si unius rei societas coita sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:65" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 65 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:65" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 17, 2, 65</bibl>, §§ 2, 9, 10, 15.</sense></entryFree>
coepio: <entryFree id="n8883" type="main" key="coepi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coepĭo</orth>, <itype>coepi, coeptum, 3</itype> (the <sense id="n8883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tempp. press.</hi> only a few times in the ante-class. period, and coepturus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 47, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 41, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 46</bibl>; the <hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi>, both in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> form, very freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">a trisyl. coëpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 619</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from co-ăpio = apo; hence coapias for coepias in Cod. Ambros.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 46</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>, and cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 248</bibl></etym>, lit. to lay hold of something on different sides, to lay hold of; hence of an action, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertake</hi> ( = incipio, which is the class. pres.). </sense><sense id="n8883.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8883.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Tempp. press.</hi>: coepiam seditiosa verba loqui, Cato ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59, 10</bibl> Müll. lubido extemplo coepere est convivium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mage si exigere coepias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 46</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque pugnas neque ego lites coepio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nihil habeat, alium quaestum coepiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: mane coepiam, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 89, 17</bibl>: <cb n="COEP" /> non Prius olfecissem, quam ille quicquam coeperet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 43</bibl> Fleck.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Neue, Formenl. 2, 616: se Hasdrubalem adgressurum, ceterum non ante coepturum, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos rite coepturi ab Homero videmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemine opinante quidnam coepturus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8883.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Tempp. perff. act.;</hi> the object usu. an <hi rend="ital">inf.;</hi> so always in Cic. and Cæs.; mostly an <hi rend="ital">inf. act.;</hi> rarely <hi rend="ital">pass.;</hi> sometimes the <case>acc.</case> of a noun or pronoun. </sense><sense id="n8883.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ver esse coeperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:615 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 615 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discere coepit, Enn. Ann. ap. Fest. s. v. sam, p. 325, 24 Müll. (v. 228 Vahl.): amare coepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire foras coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeperit inter se vesci, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 72</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n8883.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> (in the poets and histt.): <cit><quote lang="la">per terrarum orbem fruges coepisse creari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia hujuscemodi fieri coepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Lacedaemoniis pugnari coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">urbanus haberi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">institui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expleri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eligi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohiberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:5:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: coeptum est fieri, Auct. B. Afr. 69; 78; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 49, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 34, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 42, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8883.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (rare in prose; cf. B. infra): coepit cursum, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novam mapalibus urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:420" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non ego id perpetrem, quod coepi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quicquam hodie hic turbae coeperis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae coeperamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. 15: <cit><quote lang="la">hujuscemodi orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4</bibl></cit>. 37: <cit><quote lang="la">(Sabinus) obsidium coepit per praesidia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8883.7" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam primum ... Non coepisse fuit: coepta expugnare secundum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidium facti, qui coepit, habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titus Livius hexametri exordio coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si coepisset a toto corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:50" default="NO">8, 6, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro vallo castrorum ita coepit (sc. dicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Civilis ita coepit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 37</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With an ellipsis for dicere coepi, <hi rend="ital">to begin to speak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita coepit tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram data copia fandi, Maximus Ilioneus placido sic pectore coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 521</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 372</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ita coepit: numquam mihi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc modum coepit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 23, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8883.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi> and with the <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> (cf. Zumpt, Gram, § <cit><quote lang="la">221): jure coepta appellari est Canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante petitam esse pecuniam, quam esset coepta deberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">88, 301</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:90:section=209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 90, § 209</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 4, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 38, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 7, 7: quae (res) inter eos agi coeptae, neque perfectae essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello premi sunt coepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:95:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 95, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf. act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitescere discordiae intestinae coeptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 17, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. Weissenb. ad loc.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">coeptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <hi rend="ital">begun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commenced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertaken.</hi> consilium fraude coeptum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 36, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptum atque patratum bellum foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussis Carmina coepta tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">coepti fiducia belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 162</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 23, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:188" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptam deinde omissam actionem repetere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4,44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 25</bibl></cit> (cf. infra II.): <cit><quote lang="la">luce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 65</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 55: nocte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hieme,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 31</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">coeptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a work begun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertaking</hi> (most freq. after the Aug. per. and in the <number>plur.</number>; perh. never in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">also not in Hor.): ut repetam coeptum pertexere dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec taedia coepti Ulla mei capiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coepti paenitentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ultima coepto Defuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:555" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 555</bibl></cit>: ne audaci coepto deessent; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 59, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feroci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:202" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 202</bibl></cit>.—With <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene coepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene coepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">temere coepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptis meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:486" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:642 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 642 al.</bibl></cit>—Without <pos>adj.</pos>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 463</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 41, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n8883.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take a beginning</hi>,<cb n="COER" />  <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi> (most freq. since the Aug. per.; not in Cic.): neve inde navis incohandae exordium coepisset, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 282 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sic odium coepit glandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post, ubi silentium coepit... verba facit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primum deditio coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 62:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 62, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi dies coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 91:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 91, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. supra, I. 2. <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">vere coepturo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 41, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam apud Cadmiam pugna coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:50" default="NO">9, 4, 50</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando coeperit haec ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidium coepit per praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo jurgium coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 72</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 47</bibl>; and with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl> and 68; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus, uti mihi, ex virtute nobilitas coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coepiscopatus: <entryFree id="n8884" type="main" key="co^e^pisco^pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ĕpiscŏpātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an associate episcopate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 31" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coepiscopus: <entryFree id="n8885" type="main" key="co^e^pisco^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ĕpiscŏpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an associate bishop</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Lucif. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 25</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
coepto: <entryFree id="n8886" type="main" key="coepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coepto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>coepio</etym> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in Tac.; in Cic. in prose only once, apparently for a change with coepit and incipit). <sense id="n8886.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8886.1" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffidere dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi coeptant non posse tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:405" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 405</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:255" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 255</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contingere portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appetere ea, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection): <cit><quote lang="la">coercere seditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; 3, 81; 5, 10: discedere et abire, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:696" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 696</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8886.2" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid coeptas, Thraso?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 21</bibl>; and (acc. to Bentley's correction) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defectionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptata libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8886.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Intr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a beginning</hi> (only post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">coeptantem conjurationem disjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympiade septimā coeptante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte coeptante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coeptum: <entryFree id="n8887" type="main" key="coeptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coeptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. coepio, I. B. <sense id="n8887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
coeptus: <entryFree id="n8888" type="main" key="coeptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coeptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from coepio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8889" type="main" key="coeptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coeptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>coepio</etym>, <sense id="n8889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertaking</hi> (perh. only in the foll. exs.): primos suos quasi coeptus appetendi fuisse, ut, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:15:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 15, 41</bibl> Madv (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptat appetere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>): dignas insumite mentes Coeptibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:644" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 644</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coepulonus: <entryFree id="n8890" type="hapax" key="co^e^pu^lo_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ĕpŭlōnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>epulo</etym>, <sense id="n8890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellowbanqueter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">companion at a feast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coepulor: <entryFree id="n8891" type="main" key="co^e^pu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ĕpŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n8891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to feast together</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 19, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coeranus: <entryFree id="n8892" type="main" key="Coera^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Coerănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*koi/ranos</foreign>, <sense id="n8892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek Stoic philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coerator: <entryFree id="n8893" type="gloss" key="coera_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coerātor</orth>, v. curator.</entryFree>
coerceo: <entryFree id="n8894" type="main" key="co^erce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ercĕo</orth>, <itype>cui, cĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>arceo</etym>, <sense id="n8894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to enclose something on all sides</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (mundus) omnia complexu suo coërcet et continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 40, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā circum Galli lorica coërcet,</quote> <trans><tr>where the Gallic coat of mail encloses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:954" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 954</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of a band holding the hair together,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 477</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 413</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est animus vitaï claustra coërcens,</quote> <trans><tr>holding together the bands of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 396</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8894.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp. with the access. idea of hindering free motion by surrounding; <hi rend="ital">to restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shut in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold in confinement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repress</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(amnis) nullis coërcitus ripis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 342</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aqua) jubetur ab arbitro coërceri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be kept in</tr>, <tr>repressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:9:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 9, 39</bibl></cit> (cf., just before, the more usual arcere, v. arceo, II.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:22:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 22, 1</bibl>, §§ 6 and 8; <cit><quote lang="la">47, 11, 10: impetum aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of pruning plants: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem serpentem multiplici lapsu et erratico, ferro amputans coërcet ars agricolarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the vine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:5" default="NO">4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl>.—Hence, sacrum (lucum), <hi rend="ital">to trim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clip</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (operibus) intra muros coërcetur hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mortuos) noviens Styx interfusa coërcet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 439</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantalum atque Tantali Genus coërcet (Orcus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcere coërcere animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 72, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hypermnestra ... gravibus coërcita vinclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: eos morte, exsilio, vinclis, damno coërcent,<pb n="360" /> <cb n="COGI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 5, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem custodiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 3, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliae Alpibus coërcitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles coërcitus in tot receptis ex potestate hostium urbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 24, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: Messapus primas acies, postrema coërcent Tyrrhidae juvenes, <hi rend="ital">hold together</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead on</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8894.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, </sense><sense id="n8894.3" n="A" level="2"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to keep within limits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">contineo, cohibeo): ut (nos) quasi extra ripas diffluentes coërceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:76" default="NO">9, 2, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:1" default="NO">10, 4, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, the figure taken from bridling or curbing horses (cf.: frenisque coërcuit ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 643</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">spumantiaque ora coërcet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:226" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 226</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">exsultantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augustus addiderat consilium coercendi intra terminos imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—Of words bound by measure: <cit><quote lang="la">numeris verba coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 73</bibl></cit>.—But most freq., </sense><sense id="n8894.4" n="B" level="2"> Morally, <hi rend="ital">to hold some fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">some passion</hi>, etc., or <hi rend="ital">the erring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passionate person in check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to curb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correct</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">contineo, cohibeo, refreno, reprimo, domo): cupiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:89:section=208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 89, § 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabiem gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procacitatem hominis manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppliciis delicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:79 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 79 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid poenae aut infamiae metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus modis socios atque cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hominum neque beneficio, neque metu coërcitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 91, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duabus coërcitis gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 43, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 32, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberibus potius quam verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. A. supra: pueros fuste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incensum ac flagrantem animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 35</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen, quod non Multa dies et multa litura coërcuit,</quote> <trans><tr>corrected</tr>, <tr>finished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 293</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coercitio: <entryFree id="n8895" type="main" key="co^erci^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏërcĭtĭo</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">coerctĭo, cŏërtĭo, cŏërcĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coërceo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n8895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restraining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coercing; coercion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restraint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compulsion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chastisement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n8895.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">coërcitionem inhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine coërcitione magistratus,</quote> <trans><tr>on the part of the magistrates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 36, 12</bibl></cit>: quo modo judex doceri potest, si desit... interpellantis coërcitio, contentio? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignamur aliquā admonitione aut coërcitione nos castigatos, id. Ira, 2, 28, 1: vetustissimi mortalium,... sine probro, scelere eoque sine poenā aut coërcitionibus agebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an coërceri... cupidines possent, num coërcitio plus damni in rempublicam ferret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8895.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The right of coercing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">punishing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">popinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in histriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:21:5:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 21, 5, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coercitor: <entryFree id="n8896" type="hapax" key="co^erci^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏërcĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>coërceo</etym>, <sense id="n8896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who restrains</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae militaris,</quote> <trans><tr>an enforcer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 18</bibl> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
coercitus: <entryFree id="n8897" type="main" key="co^erci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏërcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from coërceo.</entryFree>
coero: <entryFree id="n8898" type="gloss" key="coero"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coero</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. curo.</entryFree>
coerro: <entryFree id="n8899" type="hapax" key="co^erro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-erro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wander about together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 3, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coerula: <entryFree id="n8900" type="main" key="coeru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coerŭla</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coerŭlĕus</orth>, etc., v. caer-.</entryFree>
coetus: <entryFree id="n8901" type="main" key="coetus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coetus</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, v. 2. coitus.</entryFree>
coeus: <entryFree id="n8902" type="main" key="Coeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Coeus</orth> (dissyl. Coe-us), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*koi=os</foreign>, <sense id="n8902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Titan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Latona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 279</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 185</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 366</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 9, 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:224" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 224</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 347</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coexercitatus: <entryFree id="n8903" type="hapax" key="co^exerci^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-exercĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n8903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exercised together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem constare ex perceptionibus consentientibus et coexercitatis ad finem vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit> (as a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)ggegumnasme/nai katalh/yeis</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
cofanus: <entryFree id="n8904" type="main" key="cofa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cofānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pelican</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Fragm. p. 609</bibl> Oud.</sense></entryFree>
cogitabilis: <entryFree id="n8905" type="main" key="co_gi^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cogito</etym>, <sense id="n8905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conceivable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imaginable</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 315, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cogitabundus: <entryFree id="n8906" type="hapax" key="co_gi^ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socrates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cogitamen: <entryFree id="n8907" type="hapax" key="co_gi^ta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thought</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Trin. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
