cogitamentum: <entryFree id="n8908" type="hapax" key="co_gi^ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thought</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 4</bibl> Esdr. 7, 22; cf. cogitamentum, <foreign lang="greek">e)nqu/mhma</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
cogitata: <entryFree id="n8909" type="main" key="co_gi^ta_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. cogito, I. b.</entryFree>
cogitate: <entryFree id="n8910" type="main" key="co_gi^ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cogito <sense id="n8910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="COGI" /></sense></entryFree>
cogitatim: <entryFree id="n8911" type="gloss" key="co_gi^ta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, pro cogitate, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61, 9</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
cogitatio: <entryFree id="n8912" type="main" key="co_gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cogito, i. e. co-agito; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=66:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 66, 7</bibl> Müll.</etym>. <sense id="n8912.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a thinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberating; thought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditation</hi> (in good prose, and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n8912.1" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatio in se ipsā vertitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatione aliquid complecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitam et fortuitam orationem commentatio et cogitatio facile vincit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 1 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem dei percipere cogitatione, non sensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatione aliquid comprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 13, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatio enim quamvis regionem potest amplecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 19, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrima et attentissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provisa et formata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male cohaerentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplices, magnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8912.2" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timoris praeteriti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum officii, tum etiam periculi mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscepti muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. 7: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationem habere argenti, amoenitatum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petendi consulatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:17:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8912.3" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeris ut suscipiam cogitationem, quidnam istis agendum putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi... occurrit cogitatio, qualis animus in corpore sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 51</bibl></cit>: cujus sit filius, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8912.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8912.5" n="A" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a thought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judgment; a resolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design. plan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">project</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes meas curas cogitationesque in rem publicam conferebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 28, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandare litteris cogitationes suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versantur in animo meo multae et graves cogitationes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteriores enim cogitationes (ut aiunt) sapientiores solent esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 5</bibl></cit> (transl. of <foreign lang="greek">*ai( deu/terai/ pws fronti/des sofw/terai</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ista cogitatio de triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redit autem illa cogitatio, quosdam fore qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: de his rebus rogo vos, ut cogitationem suscipiatis, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, C, 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatione rerum novarum abstinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23</bibl>; 2, 74; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix a tam praecipiti cogitatione revocatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8912.6" n="B" level="2"> In Cic. several times, <hi rend="ital">thought</hi> as an intellectual power, <hi rend="ital">the ability of thinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faculty of thought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the reasoning power</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vim cogitationis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:27:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 27, 66</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">(homo) solus particeps rationis et cogitationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:9:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cogitato: <entryFree id="n8913" type="main" key="co_gi^ta_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cogito, <sense id="n8913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cogitatorium: <entryFree id="n8914" type="main" key="co_gi^ta_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cogitatus</etym>, <sense id="n8914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a receptacle of thought</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">animae caro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cogitatum: <entryFree id="n8915" type="main" key="co_gi^ta_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. cogito, I. b.</entryFree>
cogitatus: <entryFree id="n8916" type="main" key="co_gi^ta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from cogito.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8917" type="main" key="co_gi^ta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cogito</etym>, <sense id="n8917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thought</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 5, p. 144, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:9:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 9, 23 al.</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 9</bibl>, cogitatus is <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
cogito: <entryFree id="n8918" type="main" key="co_gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>contr. from cŏ-ăgito, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 43</bibl> Müll.; but more prob. from con and root of aio, Sanscr. ah; cf.: nego, adagium</etym>, <sense id="n8918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pursue something in the mind</hi> (cf. agito, II.), i. e. </sense><sense id="n8918.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To consider thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi> (class. in prose and poetry); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">de aliquo</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">de aliquā re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ita</hi>, or a <hi rend="ital">rel. -clause</hi>: cogitate cum animis vestris si quid, etc., Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 1, 4</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 24, 64</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in animo cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coepi egomet mecum Aliam rem ex aliā cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 8</bibl>; 1, 1, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">placuit tum id mihi. Sic cogitabam: hic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 21</bibl>; Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic cogitabam! fore uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severā fronte curas cogitans (i. e. animo volvens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, aequum anne iniquum imperet, cogitabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="COGN" /> 1, 19; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 291</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agam cogito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 7</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 789</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 782</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec igitur cogita, vel potius excogita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. of person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Regulum cogita,</quote> <trans><tr>think</tr>, <tr>imagine</tr>, <tr>picture to yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam in eo tragoediae argumento sui oblitus tantum Catonem cogitasset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem, patrem, propinquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">o felicem illum, qui non praesens tantum, sed etiam cogitatus emendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ultimae gentes castiorem non modo viderunt sed cogitaverunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionem, Laelium, avum,</quote> <trans><tr>to think of</tr>, <tr>call to mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et majores et posteros cogitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si principem cogitares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Persas cogitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Marc. 3, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8918.2" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflections</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ideas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam ad judices Ventum est, non potuit cogitata proloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">so cogitata (mentis) eloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:72:253" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 72, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patefacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Naevii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 29, 90</bibl></cit>.—Rare in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo neque acutius ullius imperatoris cogitatum neque celerius factum usquam legimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8918.3" n="B" level="2"> Cogitare in, adversus aliquem, with an <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to think in some way in respect to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be disposed towards</hi> (very rare): si humaniter et sapienter et amabiliter in me cogitare vis, etc., Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl>, A, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl></cit> Bremi; cf. with <hi rend="ital">de aliquo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid amice de Romanis cogitabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: ut multi mihi renuntiarent... male eum de me cogitare, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 1</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: male cogitantes, Cato, R. R. praef. 4; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Karthagini male jam diu cogitanti bellum multo ante denuntio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8918.4" n="II" level="1"> In respect to a work to be undertaken or a conclusion to be made, <hi rend="ital">to have something in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n8918.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedium parare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitat recipere hunc in aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipere me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex fumo dare lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deducere exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:18 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 18 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n8918.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptiones et dictaturas cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedem principis et res novas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and parricidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mecum rem pulcherrimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:7:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum nefas in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 7, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:3" default="NO">8, 6, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua cogitarentur, gravius adversus se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid bellicosus Cantaber et Scythes cogitet,</quote> <trans><tr>what he plots</tr>, <tr>devises</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; and so <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of the (personified) wind: <cit><quote lang="la">quid cogitet humidus Auster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 462</bibl></cit> Heyne.—</sense><sense id="n8918.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque jam, ut aliquid acquireret... cogitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid... viros cogitasse arbitramur? Ut nomen suum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8918.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitavit etiam de Homeri carminibus abolendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de reddendā republicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de consciscendā morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum spiritus coepit de exitu cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 25, 1</bibl></cit>.—In epistolary style, with ellipsis, </sense><sense id="n8918.9" n="a" level="4"> Of ire: <cit><quote lang="la">in Pompeianum cogitabam inde Aeculanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 15, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8918.10" n="b" level="4"> Of manere: <cit><quote lang="la">eo die cogitabam in Anagnino, postero autem in Tusculano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eo die apud T. Titium in Anagnino manerem. Postridie autem in Laterio cogitabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit> (2, 7, 1).—Hence, * </sense><sense id="n8918.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">deliberate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum perturbatione aliquā animi, an consulto et cogitata fiat injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. cogitato).—</sense><sense id="n8918.12" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgĭtātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with mature reflection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerately</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tractare rem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vero accurate cogitateque scripsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cognata: <entryFree id="n8919" type="main" key="cogna_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. cognatus <sense id="n8919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cognatio: <entryFree id="n8920" type="main" key="cogna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cognatus</etym>. <sense id="n8920.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">blood relationship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connection by birth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8920.1" n="A" level="2"> Of men. </sense><sense id="n8920.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: societas ... quae nata a primo satu... serpit sensim foras, cognationibus primum, tum adfinitatibus,<pb n="361" /> <cb n="COGN" />  deinde amicitiis, post vicinitatibus, tum civibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater noster cognatione patruelis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque te maxime cognatione, adfinitate, necessitudine aliquā attingebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognationem commemorare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">64: cognationis jura inpetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:37:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 37, 3</bibl></cit>: propinqua, <hi rend="ital">a near</hi> or <hi rend="ital">close relationship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus gloriae faveo propter propinquam cognationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Barcina, propinquā cognatione Hannibali junctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 41, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 39, 4</bibl> (infra 2); Nep. praef. 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:20" default="NO">6, 11, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: artissimā cognatione alicui junctum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:6:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: longa or longinqua, <hi rend="ital">a distant relationship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longā quidem cognatione stirpi regiae adnexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandrum etiam longinquā cognatione contingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 10, 19</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8920.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere, sibi cum eo amicitiam cognationemque esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:26:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 26, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla tibi cum isto cognatio, nulla necessitudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 68</bibl></cit>, § 176; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 33</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">72: agere mecum per cognationem quae mihi secum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 49, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8920.4" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum cognationem agnoscerem non invitus ( = cum dis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:32:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 32, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum cognatione teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictatorem propinquā cognatione Licini se apud patres excusare solitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandro cognatio Bubaris non Darei tantum temporibus pacem praestitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:3:1" default="NO">12, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8920.5" n="B" level="2"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 203</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8920.6" n="C" level="2"> Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeparum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 33, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papyri cum calamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8920.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">kindred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allied by descent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo summae potentiae et magnae cognationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc commune dedecus familiae, cognationis, nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: cum tibi tota cognatio sarraco advehatur, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8920.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8920.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">relationship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">association</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">natural connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resemblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affinity</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (poëtis) est maxima cognatio cum oratoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 7, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognatio studiorum et artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37, § 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes artes ... quasi cognatione quādam inter se continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus... nec habebat aliquam necessitudinem aut cognationem cum oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 56, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam sibi cognationem cum praediis esse existimavit suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an potest cognatio propior ulla esse quam patriae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rerum naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum duarum,</quote> <trans><tr>subjects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum ac noctium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 33, 39, § 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in litteris proprium, quid commune, quae cum quibus cognatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:36" default="NO">1, 10, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (napthae) magna cognatio ignium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 105, 109, § 235</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8920.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., of works of art: <cit><quote lang="la">Pamphili cognatio et proelium ad Phliuntem ac victoria Atheniensium,</quote> <trans><tr>the allied commanders painted by Pamphilus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:136" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 40, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cognatus: <entryFree id="n8921" type="main" key="cogna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">co-gnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>natus, nascor</etym>, <sense id="n8921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sprung from the same stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">related by blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindred;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cognātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cognāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a blood-relation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kinsman</hi> (on either the father's or the mother's side; a more comprehensive word than agnatus, q. v.; very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n8921.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognatus vester,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinqui atque cognati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici cognatique alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognati atque affines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> post Red. ad Quir. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 27</bibl> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognatūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 209</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is mihi cognatus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8921.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicae et cognatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 20</bibl>.—With <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat Phanium esse hanc sibi cognatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8921.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of objects relating to kindred: <cit><quote lang="la">rogi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 7, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:663" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 663</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">13, 615: pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:498" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:451" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: acies (i. e. <hi rend="ital">between Cœsar and Pompey</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 4</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n8921.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8921.5" n="1" level="3"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8921.6" n="2" level="3"> Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 16, § 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8921.7" n="3" level="3"> Of other things; so (acc. to Pythagorean notions) of <cb n="COGN" /> the soul, kindr. with the Deity, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 81</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:32:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 32, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:991" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 991</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Diog. Laert. 1, 28 al.).—Of Thebes: moenia cognata Baccho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of beans, in allusion to the doctrine of transmigration: faba Pythagorae cognata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:63 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 63 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n8921.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">kindred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">related</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam cognatum mentibus nostris quam numeri ac voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:51:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 51, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(deus mundo) formam et maxime sibi cognatam et decoram dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gypsum calci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 24, 59, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 280</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (princeps) quod umquam claritudine eminuit, id veluti cognatum censet tuendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cognitio: <entryFree id="n8922" type="main" key="cogni^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cognosco</etym>. <sense id="n8922.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a becoming acquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learning to know</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquiring knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi> as a consequence of perception or of the exercise of our mental powers, <hi rend="ital">knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquaintance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cognition</hi> (in good prose; esp. freq. in Cic. and Quint.). </sense><sense id="n8922.1" n="A" level="2"> Abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitio contemplatioque naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum occultarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in studiis sententiae cognitionisque versabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi, quorum studia vitaque omnis in rerum cognitione versata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 44, 155</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">157: quorum ego copiam magnitudinem cognitionis atque artis non contemno,</quote> <trans><tr>culture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 219</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:17 al" default="NO">12, 11, 17 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae cognitione digna sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitione atque hospitio dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 37</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitio et aestimatio rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:40" default="NO">4, 2, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8922.2" n="B" level="2"> Concr. </sense><sense id="n8922.3" n="1" level="3"> ( = notio, <foreign lang="greek">kata/lhyis</foreign>.) <hi rend="ital">A conception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegi necesse est esse deos, quoniam insitas eorum vel potius innatas cognitiones habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 16</bibl> Madv.; 3, 5, 17.—</sense><sense id="n8922.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a branch of learning</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">studiosus cognitionum omnium princeps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: 25, 4, 7.—</sense><sense id="n8922.5" n="II" level="1"> Specif., a legal t. t., <hi rend="ital">a judicial examination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquiry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cognizance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trial</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne quod judicium, neve ipsius cognitio illo absente de existimatione ejus constitueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:25:section=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 25, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex earum rerum consulibus cognitionem dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, 11; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">12: captorum agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 60</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">principum et senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:20" default="NO">7, 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum capitalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 49, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsi testamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacantium militiae munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 26, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Christianis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de famosis libellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ejusmodi criminibus ac reis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Votieno Montano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter patrem et filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies cognitionis,</quote> <trans><tr>the day of trial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:32:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 32, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8922.6" n="III" level="1"> In Terence twice for agnitio, <hi rend="ital">recognition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discovery</hi> (cf. cognosco), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cognitionalis: <entryFree id="n8923" type="main" key="cogni^ti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognĭtĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cognitio, II.</etym>, <sense id="n8923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to judicial inquiry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 42, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 45, 13</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">co-gnĭtĭōnālĭter</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">introductus,</quote> <trans><tr>by judicial investigation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 63, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cognitor: <entryFree id="n8924" type="main" key="cogni^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cognosco</etym>, a judic. t. t. <sense id="n8924.0" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who has made himself familiar with a case in law;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n8924.1" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An advocate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attorney</hi> (acting in the name of the parties, who had previously appeared before the tribunal: cognitor est, qui litem alterius suscipit coram ab eo, cui datus est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57, 9</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Div. in Caecil. 4:11" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Div. in Caecil. 4, 11</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 97</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and v. advocatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 11</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:43:section=106 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 43, § 106 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 34, § 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 60, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 53</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:71 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 71 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8924.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A judge</hi>, = quaesitor, Cod. Th. 9, 27, 5; 10, 10, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:39 al" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 39 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8924.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a defender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protector</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (Caesare) auctore et cognitore hujusce sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; Auct. Harusp. 21, 45; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 38 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber dithyramborum cognitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Eloqu. p. 217" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Eloqu. p. 217</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8924.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who testifies that he knows a person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a voucher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:65:section=167 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 65, § 167 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 168; 2, 1, 5, § 13. <cb n="COGN" /></sense></entryFree>
cognitorius: <entryFree id="n8925" type="main" key="cogni^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cognitor</etym>, <sense id="n8925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to an advocate</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 82 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cognitura: <entryFree id="n8926" type="main" key="cogni^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a fiscal agent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who looks up the debtors to the treasury; a state</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s attorneyship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a state agency</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, § 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 2, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cognitus: <entryFree id="n8927" type="main" key="cogni^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from cognosco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8928" type="hapax" key="cogni^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cognosco</etym>, <sense id="n8928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a becoming acquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a knowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">variorum populorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cognobilis: <entryFree id="n8929" type="main" key="cogno_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognōbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be understood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligible</hi> (only in the two foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 5, 9</bibl></cit>, as a translation of the Aristotelian <foreign lang="greek">cunetoi/</foreign>, and in imitation of the Catonian cognobilior cognitio, Cato ib. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cognomen: <entryFree id="n8930" type="main" key="cogno_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognōmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>co-nomen</etym>. <sense id="n8930.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name added to the</hi> nomen (or name of the gens), usu. the third word in order in the full name of each citizen; sometimes followed by a fourth, the agnomen, but in the class. per. including the agnomen, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epithet</hi> (e. g. Cicero, Scipio, etc., Africanus, Asiaticus, etc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and class.): T. Manlius, qui Galli torque detracto cognomen (sc. Torquati) invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo isti T. Roscii, quorum alteri Capitoni cognomen est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; so with <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 58</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabiae felicis dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 30, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Felicem addere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 6, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Crassus cum cognomine Dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognomen ex contumeliā traxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex vero dictum cognomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponere alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristides... cognomine Justus sit appellatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere ex aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: uti, id Clu. 26, 72.—</sense><sense id="n8930.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, or in post. Aug. prose sometimes, in gen. for nomen, <hi rend="ital">a name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognomina prisca locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 69; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 530</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 163</bibl>; 3, 334; 3, 350; 8, 48; 8, 331 al.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 555</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cognomentum: <entryFree id="n8931" type="main" key="cogno_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognōmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>access. form of cognomen</etym>, <sense id="n8931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname</hi> (rare in class. prose; most freq. in Tac.; not used by Cic.; v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 15</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 8</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 15</bibl>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 4</bibl>; Messala ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8931.1" n="II" level="1"> (Like cognomen in poets, v. cognomen, II.) In gen., <hi rend="ital">a name</hi> (partic. of inanim. things or of persons to designate a peculiar quality), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 31</bibl> Nipperd.; 2, 6; 2, 60; 4, 65; 11, 11; 15, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cognominatio: <entryFree id="n8932" type="hapax" key="cogno_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognōmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>access. form of cognomen</etym>, <sense id="n8932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 87, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cognominis: <entryFree id="n8933" type="main" key="cogno_mi^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognōmĭnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<case>abl.</case> cognomine, <sense id="n8933.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>; cf.: bimestris, coelestis al.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cognomen</etym>, <hi rend="ital">like - named</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the same name</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose); with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae germanae meretrices cognomines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognomine Insubribus pago Haeduorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Absarrum cum castello cognomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox Asiacae cognomines flumini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudet cognomine terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 383</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc. (Rib. terrae); Suet. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 383</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognominem patriae suae Salamina constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cognomino: <entryFree id="n8934" type="main" key="cogno_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognōmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n8934.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish with a surname</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surname</hi>, <hi rend="ital">denominate</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">only once in Cic.): amaracum Phrygium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 3, 7, § 10</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 17</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: quo ex facto ipse posterique ejus Torquati sunt cognominati, Quadr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:133" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 10, 17, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl>: verba cognominata, i. e. <hi rend="ital">synonyms</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 15, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8934.1" n="II" level="1"> Rarely in gen., <hi rend="ital">to name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedonia... Emathia cognominata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 8</bibl>. <pb n="362" /> <cb n="COGN" /></sense></entryFree>
cognoscens: <entryFree id="n8935" type="main" key="cognoscens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognoscens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from cognosco.</entryFree>
cognoscenter: <entryFree id="n8936" type="main" key="cognoscenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognoscenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>cognosco</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> 1.</entryFree>
cognoscibilis: <entryFree id="n8937" type="main" key="cognosci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cognoscĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cognosco</etym>, <sense id="n8937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">recognizable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discernible</hi> (late Lat.), Boëth. Arist. Anal. Post. 1, 541.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cogno-scĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">recognizably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a magnitudine creaturae cognoscibiliter poterit creator videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 13, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cognosco: <entryFree id="n8938" type="main" key="cognosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">co-gnosco</orth>, <itype>gnōvi, gnĭtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n8938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi> contr. cognosti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. prol. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: cognorim, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 9</bibl>, A, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 534</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognorit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognosses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 21, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:91:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 91, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognossent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognosse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 331</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:90:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 90, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 4 al.</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 532; 2, 535), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>nosco</etym>. </sense><sense id="n8938.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To become thoroughly acquainted with</hi> (by the senses or mentally), <hi rend="ital">to learn by inquiring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learn;</hi> and, in <hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi> (cf. nosco) <hi rend="ital">to know</hi> (very freq. in all periods and species of composition); constr. with <case>acc.</case>, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause as object</hi>, and with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, the <case>abl.</case> alone, or <hi rend="ital">per</hi>, with the source, etc., of the information, and with <hi rend="ital">de.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8938.2" n="A" level="2"> By the senses: <cit><quote lang="la">credit enim sensus ignem cognoscere vere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 697</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:194" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 194</bibl>; Enn. Ann. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 9</bibl> (v. 16 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">doctas cognoscere Athenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">regiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos atque villas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Elysios campos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptum proficisci cognoscendae antiquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid dignum cognitu,</quote> <trans><tr>worth seeing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit> rem, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 275, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab iis Caesar haec dicta cognovit, qui sermoni interfuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B. C 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tantus amor casus cognoscere nostros.. Incipiam, Verg A. 2, 10: verum, quod institui dicere, miserias cognoscite sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:27:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 27, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid et litteris et nuntiis cognoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter ex perfugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 112:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 112, 1</bibl> al: <cit><quote lang="la">per exploratores cognovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 16: deditio per nuntios cognita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 2, 22</bibl></cit> Gerl.: <cit><quote lang="la">de Marcelli salute, Cic Fam. 4, 4, 3: de Bruto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Att. 5:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Sall J. 73, 1: his (quibus) rebus cognitis very freq. in the historians,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B G. 1, 19, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 30</bibl> et saep., so in <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi> cognito, vivere Ptolemaeum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 41, 5</bibl>, so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13:5:44:28:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 13, 5, 44, 28, 4 al.</bibl>; v. Zumpt, Gram. § 647.—</sense><sense id="n8938.3" n="b" level="4"> Like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">to know</hi>, the Heb. <foreign /> (v. Gesen. Lex. s. h. v 3), and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gignw/skw</foreign> (v. Lidd. and Scott, under the word, III.), euphem of sexual intercourse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 133</bibl> aliquam adulterio, Just 5, 2, 5, 22, 1, 13: cognita, Cat 61, 147; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> H 4, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8938.4" n="B" level="2"> Mentally, <hi rend="ital">to become acquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recognize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">know</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil certum sciri, nihil plane cognosci et percipi possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 51, 222</bibl></cit>, Lucr 2, 840; <cit><quote lang="la">quod Di vitiaci fratris summum in populum Romanum studium cognoverat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B. G 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 16</bibl> quem tu, cum ephebum Temni cognosses, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 21, 51</bibl> et saep.: id se a Gallicis armis atque insignibus cognovisse, <hi rend="ital">knew by their weapons and insignia</hi> (diff. from ex and ab aliquo, to learn from any one, v ab), <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B G. 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P 2, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 21, 22</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf</hi>: nunc animam quoque ut in membris cognoscere possis esse, Lucr 3, 117; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 18, 25</bibl>: cum paucitatem mililum ex castrorum exiguitate cognosceret, Caes B G. 4, 30: aetatem eorum ex dentibus, Varr R.
