R. 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed Metello jam antea experimentis cognitum erat, genus Numidarum infidum... esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J 46:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J 46, 3 al.</bibl></cit>—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter ac sperarat rempublicam se habentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel.- clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem cognosti qui siem, Ter And. 3, 4, 7: id socordiāne an casu acciderit, parum cognovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 5 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n8938.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To recognize that which is already known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acknowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">identify</hi> (rare for agnosco): vereor, ne me quoque, cum domum ab Ilio cessim revertero, Praeter canem cognoscat nemo, Varr. ap. Non. <cb n="COGO" /> p. 276, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">eum haec cognovit Myrrhina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ostendimus Cethego signum: cognovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sigilla, ova,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 349</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus exceptum est, quod intra dies XXX. domini cognovissent,</quote> <trans><tr>to identify</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut suum quisque per triduum cognitum abduceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:185" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 185</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">video et cognosco signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognito regis corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:20" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:105" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 105</bibl></cit>.—So esp., <hi rend="ital">to identify</hi> a person before a tribunal: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eum Syracusis amplius centum cives Romani cognoscerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 28, § 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8938.6" n="III" level="1"> With the access. idea of individual exertion (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gignw/skw</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to seek</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strive to know something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inquire into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to investigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi> (so freq. only as a jurid. and milit. t. t.): <cit><quote lang="la">accipe, cognosce signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n8938.7" n="A" level="2"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to examine a case in law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to investigate judicially</hi> (cf. cognitio): <cit><quote lang="la">Verres adesse jubebat, Verres cognoscebat, Verres judicabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:4 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 4, 4 al.</bibl>—So <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si judicas, cognosce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 194" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 194</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 77</bibl> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:48:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 48, § 118</bibl>. COGNITIONES, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3042</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de agro Campano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 19, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Caesaris actis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit> B, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">de hereditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:7:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac de re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>, § 27; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:35" default="NO">7, 4, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:62 al" default="NO">8, 3, 62 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 38 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae herciscundae, i. e. ex actione familiae herciscundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:35" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 5, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:2:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 27, 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8938.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of critics and the criticising public: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscere atque ignoscere, Quae veteres factitarunt, si faciunt novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. prol. 3</bibl> and 8.—And of private persons in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">et cognoscendi et ignoscendi dabitur peccati locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8938.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to reconnoitre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act the part of a scout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis esset natura montis et qualis in circuitu ascensus, qui cognoscerent, misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit> al— Also merely <hi rend="ital">to inquire into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum tuorum militum reliquiasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:37:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 37, 91</bibl></cit> (al. recognoscere).—Hence, * </sense><sense id="n8938.10" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cognoscens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">acquainted with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscens sui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 18, 25</bibl></cit>. —<pos>Subst.</pos> in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">one who investigates judicially</hi> Inscr Orell 3151; 3185.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cognoscenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cognoscenter te videam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8938.11" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cognĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acknowledged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approved.</hi> res penitus perspectae planeque cognitae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 108</bibl>, cf. id. ib 1, 20, 92; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 2</bibl>. dierum ratio pervulgata et cognita, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mur 11, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo virtute cognitā et spectatā fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 36, 104</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Galba, Otho, Vitellius nec beneficio nec injuriā cogniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>, so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 21, 45, § 99</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitiora, Ov Tr. 4, 6, 28. cognitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:M. 14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cogo: <entryFree id="n8939" type="main" key="co_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōgo</orth>, <itype>cŏēgi, cŏactum</itype> (COGVIT = cogit, Inscr Marin Fratr Arv. p. 170), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>contr. from co-ago</etym>, <sense id="n8939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive together to one point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to collect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">urge together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assemble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gather together</hi> (class. and very freq.; syn.: colligo, congrego) </sense><sense id="n8939.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8939.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (constr. as a verb of motion with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or with <pos>adv.</pos> of direction): <cit><quote lang="la">cogantur (oves) intro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 98</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves stabulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes in unum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 274</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 464</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:734" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 734</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam,</quote> <trans><tr>to collect</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 64, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">65, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">144, 1</bibl>.—So of the collecting together of fruits, also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:70" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:9" default="NO">12, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talenta ad quindecim Coëgi,</quote> <trans><tr>received</tr>, <tr>collected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 94</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:48:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 48, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 11, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orgetorix ad judicium omnem suam familiam undique coëgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem hominum ex agris, id. ib: concilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 304</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium Hypatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucina cogebat priscos ad verba Quirites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 13.—So of the collecting of troops ( = contrahere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias in unum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 10 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinem in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 80:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 80, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cb n="COGO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum Dyrrhachium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 31</bibl></cit> Gerl.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad militiam aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 85, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies in proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia undique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—And of the calling together of a senate: <cit><quote lang="la">quam cito senatum illo die coëgerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:39:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 39, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum senatus cogeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coguntur senatores non pignoribus, sed gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 3 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 13.—And of a single senator: <cit><quote lang="la">cur in senatum hesterno die tam acerbe cogerer?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:5:11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 5, 11 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex duabus syllabis in unam cogentes,</quote> <trans><tr>contracting</tr>, <tr>combining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 23</bibl></cit> Spald. and Zumpt: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex omnibus partibus cogitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8939.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8939.4" n="1" level="3"> Of liquids, <hi rend="ital">to thicken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curdle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coagulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella frigore (opp. calore remittere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac in duritiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 126</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 666</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 37, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquorem in nivem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 39, 39, § 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 42, 42, § 111</bibl>.—Similarly: <cit><quote lang="la">coacta alvus,</quote> <trans><tr>hard fœces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 3 al.</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vestis coacta,</quote> <trans><tr>fulled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 192</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8939.5" n="2" level="3"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">to draw together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contract into a narrow place</hi>: Italia coacta in angustias, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 400</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus in arctas coactus fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 15, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8939.6" n="3" level="3"> Agmen, milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to bring up the rear</hi> (cf. claudo, I. B. 2.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 27, 15</bibl>; 42, 64, 5; 42, 10, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:25 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 25 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8939.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8939.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hac re in angustum oppido nunc meae coguntur copiae (the figure borrowed from milit. lang.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ex comparato et constituto spatio defensionis in semihorae curriculum coëgisti,</quote> <trans><tr>have confined</tr>, <tr>restricted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam desperationem, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba in alternos pedes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to write in elegiac verse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n8939.9" n="B" level="2"> Esp. with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to urge one to any action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constrain</hi> (syn.: impello, compello, adigo). </sense><sense id="n8939.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coactus legibus Eam uxorem ducet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis cogendae militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 26, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n8939.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 831</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:837" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 837</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerasque ad officium redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque cogi pugnare poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 41, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n8939.12" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi coepi cogere ut rediret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:976" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 976</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:127" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> without <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 41</bibl> supra.—</sense><sense id="n8939.13" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingratiis ad depugnandum omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnites belloque ad bellum cogere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 11, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 22, 4</bibl>; 34, 18, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:204" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 204</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. G. 8, 38: aliquem in deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 1</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n8939.14" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">double acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogere aliquem aliquid, or cogi aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vos jus cogit, id voluntate impetret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sua quemque mala cogebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 15, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogi aliquid pro potestate ab tribuno,</quote> <trans><tr>to be extorted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 26, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid non mortalia pectora cogis, Auri sacra fames!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8939.15" n="2" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> of the thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ad id, quod natura cogeret, ipse quoque sibi acceleraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cogere se putat posse, rogare non sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:81:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 81, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 367</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8939.16" n="3" level="3"> Sometimes as philos. t. t. = colligo, concludo, <hi rend="ital">to infer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus id quod volumus efficitur et cogitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 2, 7, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8939.17" n="4" level="3"> Cogere agmen, <hi rend="ital">to be the last</hi> (the figure borrowed from milit. lang.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. I. B. 3. supra): ut nec duces simus, nec agmen cogamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ordinandus est dies omnis, ut tamquam cogat agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8939.18" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">coactum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a. subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulled covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mattress</hi> (cf. coactilis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8939.19" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">coactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">forced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constrained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unnatural</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod absurdum et nimis coactum foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:14:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 196</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 628</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8939.20" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">coactē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (prop. in a contracted manner; hence), <pb n="363" /> <cb n="COHA" /> </sense><sense id="n8939.21" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Shortly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coactius quid factum et festinantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:11:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8939.22" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Accurately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strictly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coactius interpretari verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8939.23" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In a forced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constrained manner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 42 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cohabitatio: <entryFree id="n8940" type="main" key="co^ha^bi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhăbĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cohabito</etym>, <sense id="n8940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dwelling together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 137" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 137 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
cohabitator: <entryFree id="n8941" type="main" key="co^ha^bi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhăbĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who dwells with any one</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 1 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cohabito: <entryFree id="n8942" type="main" key="co^ha^bi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-hăbĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dwell together</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 12 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 12 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cohaerenter: <entryFree id="n8943" type="main" key="co^haerenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhaerenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cohaereo <sense id="n8943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cohaerentia: <entryFree id="n8944" type="main" key="co^haerenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-haerentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cohaereo</etym>, <sense id="n8944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cohering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coherence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connection</hi> (rare): mundi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis et vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:13:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cohaereo: <entryFree id="n8945" type="main" key="co^haere^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-haerĕo</orth>, <itype>haesi, haesum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cling together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be united</hi>, either of that whose parts cling together, <hi rend="ital">to cohere</hi>, or of that which cleaves to something else, <hi rend="ital">to adhere.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8945.1" n="I" level="1"> Of a whole as composed of parts, or of the parts of a whole, <hi rend="ital">to cling together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be united</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cohere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowd together.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8945.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8945.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus ita apte cohaeret, ut dissolvi nullo modo queat, nisi ab eodem a quo est colligatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia autem duo ad cohaerendum tertium aliquid anquirunt et quasi nodum vinculumque desiderant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim materiam ipsam cohaerere potuisse, si nullā vi contineretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni naturā cohaerente et continuatā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec res ulla magis primoribus ex elementis Indupedita suis arte conexa cohaeret Quam validi ferri natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1010" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1010</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidā primordia... Quae minimis stipata cohaerent partibus arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 610</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se juga velut serie cohaerentia,</quote> <trans><tr>continuous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—Of persons in a throng, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">alii extremo complexu suorum cohaerentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of soldiers in line of battle: conferti et quasi cohaerentes tela vibrare non poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of two contending armies: duae quippe acies ita cohaerebant, ut armis arma pulsarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of ships: binas quadriremes Macedones inter se ita junxerant, ut prorae cohaererent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: conexis et cohaerentibus aedificiis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.4" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to consist in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be composed of;</hi> with <case>abl.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum alia quibus cohaererent homines e mortali genere sumpserint, quae fragilia essent et caduca, animum esse ingeneratum a deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: mundus omnibus partibus inter se congruentibus cohaeret et nititur, etc., Cic. Leg. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 8, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8945.6" n="1" level="3"> Of persons united by kindred, friendship, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">united</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpes ac perniciosos, etiamsi nobis sanguine cohaereant, amputandos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim mihi perjucundum quod viri optimi mihique amicissimi adeo cohaesistis ut invicem vos obligari putetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.7" n="2" level="3"> Of things. </sense><sense id="n8945.8" n="a" level="4"> In discourse, <hi rend="ital">to belong together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be closely connected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae... si suis quaeque temporibus reddere voluero, interrumpendae sunt res Asiae, quas... sicut inter se cohaerent, ita opere ipso conjungi aptius videri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.9" n="b" level="4"> In thought, <hi rend="ital">to be consistent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">em, Paululum obsoni, ipsus tristis, de inproviso nuptiae—Non cohaerent,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>cannot all be here at once</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam eras excors, ut... non modo non cohaerentia inter se diceres, sed maxime dijuncta atque contraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitandum non est quin numquam possit utilitas cum honestate contendere. Itaque accepimus Socratem exsecrari solitum eos qui primum haec naturā cohaerentia opinione distraxissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quaero jam, verumne sit: illud dico, ea, quae dicat, praeclare inter se cohaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:27:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 27, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadvertisti, quam multa dicta sint, quamque, etiam si minus vera, tamen apta inter se et cohaerentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male cohaerens cogitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus inter se juncti, atque ita cohaerentes, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:20" default="NO">9, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:63" default="NO">9, 4, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo hercule familiaris et cottidianus non cohaerebit, si verba inter nos aucupamur,</quote> <trans><tr>have a consistent meaning</tr>, <tr>be intelligible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix diserti adulescentis cohaerebat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; and of harmony in the arrangement of words: conlocabuntur igitur verba, ut aut inter se aptissime cohaereant extrema cum primis <cb n="COHI" /> eaque sint quam suavissimis vocibus, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec collocatio verborum ... quae junctam orationem efficit, quae cohaerentem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.10" n="3" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to hold together</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus modis fulciendi sunt, qui ruunt nec cohaerere possunt propter magnitudinem aegritudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:25:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes sine vitā beatā cohaerere non possunt, nec sine virtute vita beata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 28, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix haec, si undique fulciamus, jam labefacta... nixa in omnium nostrum umeris cohaerebunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:27:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 27, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.11" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cling closely to</hi> something else, <hi rend="ital">to adhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be connected with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleave to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in contact with</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n8945.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8945.13" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temptanti dextera flxa est Cuspide Marmaridae Corythi, lignoque cohaesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec equo mea membra cohaerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopuloque affixa cohaesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus quamdiu solo cohaerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:63" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superficies... quae natura solo cohaeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:44:section=1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 44, 7, 44, § 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe turris... muris hostium propemodum cohaerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">experimentum marmorati est in subigendo donec rutro non cohaereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cohaerent Mesopotamiae Rhoali vocantur,</quote> <trans><tr>adjoin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.14" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid enim sequitur quamque rem, id cohaeret cum re necessario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:12:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 12, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.15" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohaerentis videmus in conchis (margaritas), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.16" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque ea (navis) quae non cohaerebat,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>which did not collide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.17" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be closely connected with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in agreement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harmony with</hi> something else, <hi rend="ital">to be consistent with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod illa, quae prima dicuntur, si vehementer velis congruere et cohaerere cum causā, ex eis ducas oportet, quae post dicenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:14:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si continget, etiam (id quod fingemus) verae alicui rei cohaereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non tamquam citharoedi prooemium adfictum aliquid, sed cohaerens cum omni corpore membrum videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditis tot gentes... non sacris, non moribus, non commercio linguae nobiscum cohaerentes, eodem proelio domitas esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia male cohaerens inter Pompeium et Caesarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:47:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 47, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.18" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be vitally connected with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to depend upon</hi> a thing; with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ita legibus Sullae cohaerere statum civitatis adfirmat, ut iis solutis stare ipsa non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 85</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8945.19" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhae-rens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (cohering, i.e.), <hi rend="ital">being in accord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corresponding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptius et cohaerentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n8945.20" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhaerenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">continuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninterruptedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8945.21" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhaesus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pressed together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus stricta denuo et cohaesa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cohaeres: <entryFree id="n8946" type="main" key="co^haeres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhaeres</orth>, <itype>ēdis</itype>, v. coheres.</entryFree>
cohaeresco: <entryFree id="n8947" type="main" key="co^haeresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-haeresco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-hēresco</orth>), <itype>si, 3</itype>, <sense id="n8947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [cohaereo], <hi rend="ital">to hang together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cohere</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">atomi cohaerescunt inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pituita in gulā cohaerescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 80, § 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:172" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 16, 64, § 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cohaesus: <entryFree id="n8948" type="main" key="co^haesus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhaesus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from cohaereo.</entryFree>
coheres: <entryFree id="n8949" type="main" key="co^he_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-hēres</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-haeres</orth>), <itype>ēdis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <sense id="n8949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coheir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellow-heir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:48:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 48, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 46 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 16</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> coheredum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse coheres alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 76, 2</bibl>.— In the <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:9:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 9, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cohibeo: <entryFree id="n8950" type="main" key="co^hi^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-hĭbĕo</orth>, <itype>ui</itype> (<sense id="n8950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> cohibessit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 444</bibl> Lachm.), <itype>ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>habeo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n8950.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hold together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprise</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. contineo): omnes naturas ipsa (universa natura) cohibet et continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:13:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 13, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:441 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 441 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:517" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 517</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:536" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 536</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nubes) ut fumus constare nequirent, Nec cohibere nives gelidas et grandinis imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1031" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1031</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Scyllam caecis cohibet spelunca latebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen occaecatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodo crinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">namque marem cohibent callosa (ova) vitellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro lacertos,</quote> <trans><tr>to encircle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium togā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos parietibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8950.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare): sed interest inter causas fortuito antegressas, et inter causas cohibentis in se efficientiam<cb n="COHO" />  naturalem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8950.3" n="II" level="1"> With the access. idea of hindering free motion, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, etc. (in a lit. sense in prose rare, but trop. very freq.). </sense><sense id="n8950.4" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">cohibete intra limen etiam vos parumper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec muris cohibet patriis media Ardea Turnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 738</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcere ventos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventos in antris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:346" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 346</bibl></cit>: cervos arcu, <hi rend="ital">to stop</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Stygiā cohibebor undā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatibus in portibus cohiberi, Auct. B. Afr. 98: cohiberi in vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pirithoum cohibent catenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra cohibentia Janum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis spongiā in aceto tinctā cohibendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 69, § 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites intra castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:3:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilones jugis montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8950.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8950.6" n="1" level="3"> Cohibere aliquid or cohibere se, <hi rend="ital">to stop something</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to hold in check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">contineo, refreno, arceo, coerceo): motus animi perturbatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furentis impetus crudelissimosque conatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia clausa in sinu tacito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 25, 30: <cit><quote lang="la">iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pravas aliorum spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac premeret sensus suos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentias effrenati doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudinem aedificiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(provinciae) quae procuratoribus cohibentur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are ruled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: non tu te cohibes? <hi rend="ital">be moderate in grief</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 46</bibl>; so Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8950.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix cohibuere amici, quominus eodem mari oppeteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne flumine quidem interjecto, cohiberi quominus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8950.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:20" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 20</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:25:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 25, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 23, 66</bibl>; Auct. B. G. 8, 23, prohibere is the true reading).—</sense><sense id="n8950.9" n="2" level="3"> Aliquid ab aliquā re or aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to keep something from something</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">somebody</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to ward off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ab alieno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus, oculos, animum ab auro gazāque regiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:23:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effrenatas suas libidines a liberis et a conjugibus vestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 28, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsensionem a rebus incertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhĭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">confined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitudo cohibitior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 27, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cohibilis: <entryFree id="n8951" type="main" key="co^hi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cohibeo</etym>, <sense id="n8951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abridged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">sunexh/s</foreign> (only trop. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">oratio Herodoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 1</bibl></cit> dub.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhĭbĭlĭter</orth>; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohibilius conscribere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 36, p. 297, 35</bibl></cit> Elm.: cogere fabulam, App. Flor. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cohibiliter: <entryFree id="n8952" type="main" key="co^hi^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cohibilis.</entryFree>
cohibitio: <entryFree id="n8953" type="main" key="co^hi^bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhĭbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cohibeo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n8953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restraining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">governing</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">irae, Lact. de Ira Dei, 18, 3: sui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 12</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 37</bibl>, the better read. is prohibitio).</sense></entryFree>
cohibitus: <entryFree id="n8954" type="main" key="co^hi^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhĭbĭtus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from cohibeo.</entryFree>
cohonesto: <entryFree id="n8955" type="main" key="co^ho^nesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-hŏnesto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to honor in common</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do honor to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi> (rare, but in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">exsequias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus laudatione pro rostris ceterisque solennibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:69:section=168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 69, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">MEMORIAM PVELLAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5037</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 47, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 16, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res turpes,</quote> <trans><tr>to call by honorable names</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 187</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8955.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to palliate</hi>: defluvia capitis, <hi rend="ital">to prevent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cure the falling off of the hair</hi> (by which the head is disfigured), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 13, 15, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cohorresco: <entryFree id="n8956" type="main" key="co^horresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-horresco</orth>, <itype>horrui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n8956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shudder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">shiver with fear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cold</hi>: nisi cohorrescit corpus meum, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ubi agnovi, equidem cohorrui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo (sudore) cum cohorruisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cohors: <entryFree id="n8957" type="main" key="co^hors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhors</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cors</orth>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 83, 14 sq.</bibl>; later aspirated orthog. of MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">chors</orth>; cf. the letter C, and Schne<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Varr. R. R. 1, 13, 3</bibl>), <itype>rtis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root har, rapio; cf. <pb n="364" /> <cb n="COHO" /> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xoro/s</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n8957.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place enclosed around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pen</hi>, etc., esp. for cattle, poultry, etc. </sense><sense id="n8957.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Cohors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:2:9" default="NO">2, 2, 9</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=146:29" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 146, 29</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:8" default="NO">7, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:704" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 704</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n8957.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Cors, Varr. ap. Non. l. l.; Glaucia ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:45:2" default="NO">13, 45, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8957.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (cf. chorus). </sense><sense id="n8957.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the multitude enclosed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fenced in;</hi> hence, in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a company of soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a division of an army</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cohort</hi>, the tenth part of a legion, comprising three manipuli or six centuriae (always written cohors), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=88" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 88</bibl>; Cincius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 6</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:105:2" default="NO" valid="yes">105, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 279</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:500 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 500 al.</bibl>: praetoria, <hi rend="ital">the prœtorian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bodyguard of the general</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 3 al.</bibl>—Hence, trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">habere scortorum cohortem praetoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8957.5" n="2" level="3"> Opp. legiones, <hi rend="ital">auxiliary troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 112, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8957.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A troop of cavalry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centurio cohortis sextae equestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 106</bibl></cit> (107) sq.—</sense><sense id="n8957.7" n="4" level="3"> Per synecdochen, <hi rend="ital">an army</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors Inachiae servatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:672" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 672</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8957.8" n="B" level="2"> Specif., <hi rend="ital">the train</hi> or <hi rend="ital">retinue of the prœtor in a province</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 27</bibl>, § 66; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8957.9" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">company</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throng</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendants</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">vaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gigantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrum stipata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 328</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:60" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicarum,</quote> <trans><tr>of courtiers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">febrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cohortalinus: <entryFree id="n8958" type="main" key="co^horta_li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhortālīnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cort-</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 22, 2</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cohortalis</etym> (late Lat.), <sense id="n8958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to an imperial body-guard</hi>: militia, Cod. Th. 16, 5, 48; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 35, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cohortalis: <entryFree id="n8959" type="main" key="co^horta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhortālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cort-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cohors</etym>. <sense id="n8959.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to a cattle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poultry-yard</hi> (freq. in Col.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere very rare): aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 27; 6, 27, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 1, 3: gallina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8959.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to an imperial body - guard</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">officium, Cod. Th. 12, 58, 13: condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:16:62:3 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 62, 3 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cohortatio: <entryFree id="n8960" type="main" key="co^horta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhortātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cohortor</etym>, <sense id="n8960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an exhorting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inciting; exhortation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encouragement</hi> (rare, but in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris, Auct. B. Alex. 22: ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:50:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 50, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibiliter me commovet tua cohortatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl></cit>, C, 2; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his cohortationibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 61, 262</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cohortatiuncula: <entryFree id="n8961" type="hapax" key="co^horta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhortātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cohortatio</etym>, <sense id="n8961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short exhortation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 4, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cohorticula: <entryFree id="n8962" type="hapax" key="co^horti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhortĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cohors</etym>, <sense id="n8962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small cohort</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cohorto: <entryFree id="n8963" type="main" key="co^horto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhorto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (rare collat. form of cohortor), <sense id="n8963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to exhort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi>: et dicerent castra capta esse, atque hos cohortarent uti maturarent, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 472, 19</bibl>: exercitus pransus, paratus, cohortatus, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 5</bibl>; v. cohortor.</sense></entryFree>
