cohortor: <entryFree id="n8964" type="main" key="co^hortor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-hortor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n8964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to animate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi> by forcible language, <hi rend="ital">to incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admonish.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8964.1" n="I" level="1"> Esp., of the general before a battle, or in other milit. proceedings: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortatus suos proelium commisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies instruenda, milites cohortandi, signum dandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ad pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem ad proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8964.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 21; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8964.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionis milites cohortatur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse adit reliquos, cohortatur, ne labori succumbant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. II.—</sense><sense id="n8964.4" n="II" level="1"> In gen., and without the sphere of military operations (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n8964.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac (eloquentiā) et cohortamur, hac persuademus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ne majorem vim ad deterrendum habuerit quam ad cohortandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 258</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8964.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar Remos cohortatus liberaliterque oratione prosecutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non sibi cohortandum Sulpicium, sed magis conlaudandum videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8964.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem ad aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: in <cb n="COIT" /> hominibus ad virtutis studium cohortandis, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad studium summae laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: ad pacem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl>, A, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">ad concordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad libertatem recuperandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8964.8" n="4" level="3"> With final clause; with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem cohortatus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortantibus invicem, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cohospes: <entryFree id="n8965" type="main" key="co^hospe^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-hospĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-guest</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 385</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 438</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cohospitans: <entryFree id="n8966" type="main" key="co^hospi^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhospĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, = cohospes, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 32, 6</bibl>.</entryFree>
cohum: <entryFree id="n8967" type="gloss" key="cohum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cohum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the strap by which the plough-beam was fastened to the yoke;</hi> so called, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=39:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 39, 4</bibl>, a cohibendo; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=135" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 135</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8968" type="main" key="co^hum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏhum</orth> poëtae caelum dixerunt a chao, ex quo putabant caelum esse formatum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=39:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 39, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 361</bibl> P.: <sense id="n8968.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">vix solidum complere cohum terroribus caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 550" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 550</bibl></cit> Vahl.</sense></entryFree>
cohumido: <entryFree id="n8969" type="main" key="co^hu_mi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-hūmĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to moisten all over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genas lacrimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 205, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coillum: <entryFree id="n8970" type="greek" key="coillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coillum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koi=lon</foreign>, <sense id="n8970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inmost part of the house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the Lares were worshipped</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coimbibo: <entryFree id="n8971" type="main" key="co^imbi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-imbĭbo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to imbibe along with</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coinquenda: <entryFree id="n8972" type="gloss" key="Co^inquenda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏinquenda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess who presided over the felling of trees</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 961</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coinquinatio: <entryFree id="n8973" type="main" key="co^inqui^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏinquĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coinquino</etym>, <sense id="n8973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a polluting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Esd. 1, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Ep. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coinquino: <entryFree id="n8974" type="main" key="co^inqui^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-inquĭno</orth> (or contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnquĭno</orth>, cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 135</bibl>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to defile all over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pollute wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to contaminate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8974.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): stercore conquinatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:2" default="NO">8, 7, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8974.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n8974.3" n="A" level="2"> Of infectious disease, <hi rend="ital">to infect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam progeniem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n8974.4" n="B" level="2"> Of vices: matres coinquinari regias, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se crimine stupri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se maximo scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor vitiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 151</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏinquĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">polluted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contaminated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid esse his potest coinquinatius?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 222</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coinquo: <entryFree id="n8975" type="gloss" key="co^inquo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-inquo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏninquo</orth>), <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-inquio</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut down</hi> (belonging to econ. lang.), Trebat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 316</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2270</bibl> (I. p. 390 sq.); cf.: coinquere = deputare, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 3</bibl>, and 65, 19 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
coiro: <entryFree id="n8976" type="gloss" key="coiro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coiro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. curo.</entryFree>
coitio: <entryFree id="n8977" type="main" key="co^i^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coëo</etym>. * <sense id="n8977.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A coming</hi> or <hi rend="ital">meeting together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a meeting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima coitio est acerrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8977.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8977.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A uniting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banding together.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8977.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">societatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:70" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 70</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8977.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a conspiracy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coalition</hi> (several times in Cic. and Liv.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): suspitio coitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 22, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:54:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 54, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non factionibus modo nec per coitiones usitatas nobilibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 35, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 35, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidatorum consularium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memmii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14</bibl></cit> (15), 4: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 65, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 22, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8977.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sexual intercourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coition</hi> (post-class. for coitus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 16</bibl>; Cod. Th. 15, 8, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coitus: <entryFree id="n8978" type="main" key="co^i^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from coëo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8979" type="main" key="co^i^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏĭtus</orth>, and another orthography <orth extent="full" lang="la">coetus</orth> (only distinguished in signif. by use; <sense id="n8979.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), ūs (<case>dat.</case> coetu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 385</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:37" default="NO" valid="yes">66, 37</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>coëo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n8979.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n8979.2" n="A" level="2"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a coming</hi> or <hi rend="ital">meeting together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an assembling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos auspicio meo atque ductu primo coetu vicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n8979.3" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">an assemblage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">company;</hi> in this signif. coetus alone is used: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (opiniones) in senatu, quae in omni coetu concilioque profitendae sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:13:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 13, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad divinum animorum concilium coetumque proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 35, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:9:2" default="NO">2, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:8" default="NO">8, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 46, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:407" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 407</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 403</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 766</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domum Pisonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8979.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp. <cb n="COLL" /> </sense><sense id="n8979.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A uniting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joining together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combination;</hi> so in both forms. </sense><sense id="n8979.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Coetus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1016" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1016</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1047" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1047</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:919" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 919</bibl>; 2, 1003; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 429: ceterum amnium coctus maritimis similes fluctus movet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum coetus et discessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8979.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Coitus: <cit><quote lang="la">ut recens coitus venae resolvatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 18, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordium in auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:25:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 25, 16</bibl></cit>: osculi, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna morata in coitu solis biduo (i. e. at new moon),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 44</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8979.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sexual intercourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coition</hi> (not in Cic.); <cit><quote lang="la">in this signif. only coitus is used.— Of men,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 709</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 24</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 87</bibl>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:23:3" default="NO">6, 23, 3</bibl> (Cod. Polit. coetus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n8979.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">palmarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 35</bibl></cit>.— Also of <hi rend="ital">ingrafting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coix: <entryFree id="n8980" type="greek" key="co^ix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/i+c</foreign>, <sense id="n8980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of Ethiopian palm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 47</bibl> (Jan. coecas).</sense></entryFree>
cojugalis: <entryFree id="n8981" type="main" key="co^ju^ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏjŭgālis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏjux</orth>, v. conj-.</entryFree>
colaphizo: <entryFree id="n8982" type="greek" key="co^la^phi_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlăphīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kolafi/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n8982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to box one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s ears</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colaphus: <entryFree id="n8983" type="greek" key="co^la^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/lafos</foreign>, <sense id="n8983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blow with the fist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a box on the ear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">icere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 65</bibl></cit> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 83</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cerebro colaphos abstrudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infringere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incutere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colatura: <entryFree id="n8984" type="hapax" key="co_la_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. colo</etym>, <sense id="n8984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filtration;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">that which has been strained</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:3:55" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 3, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colatus: <entryFree id="n8985" type="main" key="co_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 2. colo.</entryFree>
colax: <entryFree id="n8986" type="main" key="Co^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/lac</foreign> (the Flatterer), <sense id="n8986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">title of comedies of Menander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Nœvius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Plautus;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 25</bibl> and 30.</sense></entryFree>
colchi: <entryFree id="n8987" type="main" key="Colchi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Colchi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Colchis, II. B. <sense id="n8987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
colchis: <entryFree id="n8988" type="main" key="Colchi^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Colchĭs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (ĭdŏs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:423" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 423</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:202" default="NO">5, 202</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kolxi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a province in Asia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">east of the Black Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated on account of the golden fleece and Medea;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Mingrelia; acc.</hi> Colchida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:505 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 505 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8988.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n8988.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Colchis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Colchian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:418" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 418</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Colchian woman</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign> = <hi rend="ital">Medea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:58" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 34, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 301</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 348</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Colchida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 21, 11; <case>voc.</case> Colchĭ, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 262</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Colchide, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 331</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:643" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 643</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8988.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Colchus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Colchian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:876" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 876</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Medea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhombus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>magical</tr>, <tr>enchanting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:57:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 57, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Col-chus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Colchian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 118</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Colchi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the Colchians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">meton. for Colchis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8988.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Colchĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Colchian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <trans><tr>of Medea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:35" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. the preced.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">col-chĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant with a poisonous root</hi>: Colcbicum auctumnale, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coleatus: <entryFree id="n8989" type="main" key="co_le^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>colis = caulis, II. D.</etym>, <sense id="n8989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the</hi> membrum virile: cuspis, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 470, 31</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 69 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">eculeus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17</bibl></cit> (Com. Rel. v. 40 ib.).</sense></entryFree>
colepium: <entryFree id="n8990" type="greek" key="co_le_pi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlēpĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwlh/pion</foreign>, <sense id="n8990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a knuckle of beef</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pork</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 17, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coles: <entryFree id="n8991" type="main" key="co_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōles</orth>, v. caulis.</entryFree>
coleus: <entryFree id="n8992" type="main" key="co_le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. culeus.</entryFree>
colias: <entryFree id="n8993" type="greek" key="co^li^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koli/as</foreign>, <sense id="n8993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of tunny-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colice: <entryFree id="n8994" type="greek" key="co_li^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwlikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n8994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a remedy for the colic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 25, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 120 sq" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 120 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
coliculus: <entryFree id="n8995" type="main" key="co_li^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. cauliculus.</entryFree>
colicus: <entryFree id="n8996" type="greek" key="co_li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the colic; suffering from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sick with the colic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 4, 28</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
colina: <entryFree id="n8997" type="main" key="co^li_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlīna</orth>, v. culina.</entryFree>
coliphium: <entryFree id="n8998" type="main" key="co_li_phi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlīphĭum</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">coll-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of nourishing food for athletœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 53</bibl>; cf. colepium.</sense></entryFree>
colis: <entryFree id="n8999" type="main" key="co_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. caulis.</entryFree>
collabasco: <entryFree id="n9000" type="hapax" key="colla^basco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lăbasco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to totter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be about to fall at the same time</hi>, <pb n="365" /> <cb n="COLL" /> <hi rend="ital">to waver with</hi>, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: si res lassa labat, itidem amici collabascunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collabefacto: <entryFree id="n9001" type="main" key="colla^be^facto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lăbĕfacto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make to reel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">totter</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">motu collabefactat onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:566" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 566</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of liquefying metals: <cit><quote lang="la">rigorem auri,</quote> <trans><tr>to overpower</tr>, <tr>subdue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 493</bibl></cit>; cf. collabefio.</sense></entryFree>
collabefio: <entryFree id="n9002" type="main" key="colla^be^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lăbĕfīo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>factus, fiĕri</itype>, <sense id="n9002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be made to reel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">totter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be brought to ruin</hi> (perh. only in the foll. examples): <cit><quote lang="la">haec (mens animaeque potestas) ipso cum corpore collabefiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>sink together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 585</bibl></cit> (601): <cit><quote lang="la">ut altera (navis) praefracto rostro tota collabefieret,</quote> <trans><tr>was dashed in pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of the melting of metals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 697</bibl> (cf. collabefacto; <cit><quote lang="la">and labefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 390</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n9002.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Themistocle collabefactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collabello: <entryFree id="n9003" type="hapax" key="colla^bello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lăbello</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form by bringing the lips together</hi>: osculum, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collabor: <entryFree id="n9004" type="main" key="colla_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lābor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>lapsus</itype> (or labsus), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n9004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall in ruins;</hi> esp. of buildings, <hi rend="ital">to fall in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall from age</hi> (in the ante-Aug. period very rare; not in Cic., Hor., or Quint.). </sense><sense id="n9004.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia subito collapsa ruinā sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 18, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigium domūs collabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui collapsā jacuere ruinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:727" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succisis asseribus collapsus pons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5, 6</bibl></cit>. postquam conlapsi cineres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 226</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem anno duodecim celebres Asiae urbes collapsae nocturno motu terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AEDES VETVSTATE COLLAPSA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 26</bibl></cit>.—Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sink down in a swoon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipiunt famulae collapsaque membra Marmoreo referunt thalamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 391</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 584</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 826</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 295</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:22" default="NO">7, 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:39" default="NO">8, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:152" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 152</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 195</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro collapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 664</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9004.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa morbo collapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 485</bibl></cit>: collapsa tempora, oculi concavi, <hi rend="ital">temples fallen in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sunken</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter urinae senectute collapsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9004.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in corruptelam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira in se ipsa collapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 14, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collaboro: <entryFree id="n9005" type="hapax" key="colla^bo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lăbōro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to labor with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collabus: <entryFree id="n9006" type="main" key="Colla^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Collăbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>con and <foreign lang="greek">lab-, lamba/nw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n9006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comic name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collaceratus: <entryFree id="n9007" type="main" key="colla^ce^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lăcĕrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [lacero], <sense id="n9007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">torn to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lacerated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
collacrimatio: <entryFree id="n9008" type="hapax" key="colla_^cri^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lā^crĭmātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>col-lacrimo</etym>, <sense id="n9008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weeping together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lamenting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 190</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collacrimo: <entryFree id="n9009" type="main" key="colla_^cri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lā^crĭmo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-lacrŭmo</orth>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n9009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weep together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bewail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deplore</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n9009.1" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: simul omnes collacrumarunt, Plaut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:24:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conplexus me senex collacrimavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collacrimantes suum patriaeque casum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9009.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">histrio casum suum toties collacrimavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 58, 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collactaneus: <entryFree id="n9010" type="main" key="collacta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lactānĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a</itype> <etym>lacteo</etym>, <sense id="n9010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brother</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sister nourished at the same breast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a foster-brother</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sister</hi> (post-class.); <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2281 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:30:section=1 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 4, 30, § 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
collacteus: <entryFree id="n9011" type="main" key="collacte^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lactĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n9011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foster-brother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foster-sister; masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 224" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 224</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 678</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:307" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 307</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, § 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collacticius: <entryFree id="n9012" type="gloss" key="collacti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collactīcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = collactaneus, Inscr. Afr. Renier, 509.</entryFree>
collaetor: <entryFree id="n9013" type="hapax" key="collaetor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-laetor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n9013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rejoice together</hi>, Tert. ldol. 14.</sense></entryFree>
collaevo: <entryFree id="n9014" type="main" key="collaevo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collaevo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, v. collevo.</entryFree>
collapsio: <entryFree id="n9015" type="hapax" key="collapsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collapsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>collabor</etym>, <sense id="n9015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitation</hi>: fulminum, Jul. Firm. Err. Prof. Relig. 21.</sense></entryFree>
collapsus: <entryFree id="n9016" type="main" key="collapsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collapsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from collabor.</entryFree>
collare: <entryFree id="n9017" type="main" key="colla_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collāre</orth> (<sense id="n9017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> first in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 5 sq.</bibl>), is (<orth extent="full" lang="la">collārium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 590</bibl> P.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>collum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a band</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chain for the neck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a collar; abl.</hi> collari, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 36, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 107</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> collaria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> <cb n="COLL" /></sense></entryFree>
collaris: <entryFree id="n9018" type="main" key="colla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>collum</etym>, <sense id="n9018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the neck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">offa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 56, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collatatus: <entryFree id="n9019" type="hapax" key="colla_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collātātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>from collato, not in use</etym>, <sense id="n9019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">extended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diffuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio collatata et diffusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:187" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 187</bibl></cit> dub. (al. dilatata).</sense></entryFree>
collatero: <entryFree id="n9020" type="hapax" key="colla^te^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lătĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. latus</etym>, <sense id="n9020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to admit on both sides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C vocales utrimque collaterat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 249</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collatia: <entryFree id="n9021" type="main" key="Colla_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Collātĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kollati/a</foreign>, <sense id="n9021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town of the Sabines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the vicinity of Rome</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Castellaccio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 57, 9 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:733" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 733</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 785</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9021.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Collātīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Collatia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38, 2</bibl></cit> (four times): <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 774</bibl></cit> Heyne: porta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=37:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 37, 10</bibl> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Collātīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Collatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38, 1</bibl> (diff. from a people of the same name in Apulia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>); and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Collātīnus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">cognomen of</hi> L. Tarquinius, <hi rend="ital">husband of Lucretia</hi>, since he lived there, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 6</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">penetralia,</quote> <trans><tr>of Collatinus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:787" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 787</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collaticius: <entryFree id="n9022" type="main" key="colla_ti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collātĭcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>confero</etym>, <sense id="n9022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brought together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raised by contribution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mingled</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">instrumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 10:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrrha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 16, 35, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepultura,</quote> <trans><tr>effected by contributions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 6:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PECVNIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3730</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collatinus: <entryFree id="n9023" type="main" key="Colla_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Collātīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Collatia, II.</entryFree>
collatio: <entryFree id="n9024" type="main" key="colla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confero</etym>, <sense id="n9024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringing together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collecting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9024.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., of the standards in war for battle, <hi rend="ital">a hostile meeting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 210</bibl></cit>: centuriarum, for voting, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:in Toga Cand. p. 85:18" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> in Toga Cand. p. 85, 18</bibl> Baiter: <cit><quote lang="la">hyacinthorum et auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 42, § 126</bibl></cit>.—Of money, <hi rend="ital">a contribution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gratuity collected together for the emperor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipis aut decimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 60, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 14, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:41:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 41, 1</bibl> Schwarz.—In jurid. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">collatio bonorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the putting together of the possessions of several</tr>, <tr>in order to divide them equally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:6:1:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 6, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>; cf. Cod. 6, 20: de collationibus, et saep.— </sense><sense id="n9024.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9024.3" n="A" level="2"> Malitiarum, <hi rend="ital">a union</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combination</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9024.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A comparison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similitude</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">parabolh/</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">collatio est oratio rem cum re ex similitudine conferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:28:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 28, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 17, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:38:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 38, 84</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:2" default="NO">7, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 42, § 126</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n9024.5" n="C" level="2"> In philos.: <cit><quote lang="la">collatio rationis,</quote> <trans><tr>the analogy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 10, 33</bibl></cit> Madv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 27</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum saepe factarum inter se collatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 120, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9024.6" n="D" level="2"> In gram.: collatio secunda, <hi rend="ital">the comparative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collatio tertia,</quote> <trans><tr>the superlative</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181:28" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181, 28</bibl></cit>, and 286, 26 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n9024.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The comparison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collation</hi> of texts, manuscripts, etc. (late Lat.): aliquem multorum codicum vetustiorum collatione confutare. Aug. c. Faust. 32, 16.</sense></entryFree>
collatitius: <entryFree id="n9025" type="main" key="colla_titi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collātitĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. collaticius.</entryFree>
collativus: <entryFree id="n9026" type="main" key="colla_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>collatus, confero</etym>, <sense id="n9026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carried together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combined</hi> (very rare): collativum sacrificium dicitur, quod ex collatione offertur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=37:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 37, 13</bibl> Müll.: collativum ventrem magnum et turgidum dixit Plautus (Curc. 2, 1, 16), quia in eum omnia edulia congeruntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58, 17</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">favor,</quote> <trans><tr>common</tr>, <tr>joint</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. ad Const. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n9026.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">collātīvum</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = collatio, I., <hi rend="ital">a contribution in money</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 26, 3.</sense></entryFree>
collator: <entryFree id="n9027" type="main" key="colla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>confero</etym>. <sense id="n9027.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who bears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">places together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contributor</hi>, etc. (ante- and post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">symbolarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">one who pays a voluntary contribution to the state</hi>, Cod. Th. 7, 6, 5.—</sense><sense id="n9027.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who compares</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a comparer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et disputator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 147" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collatro: <entryFree id="n9028" type="hapax" key="colla_tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lātro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">yelp fiercely at;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to inveigh against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 17:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collatus: <entryFree id="n9029" type="main" key="colla_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from confero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9030" type="main" key="colla_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ū s</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>confero</etym>, <sense id="n9030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringing together</hi> (perh. only in the foll. <cb n="COLL" /> exs.; only in the <case>abl.</case>). </sense><sense id="n9030.1" n="I" level="1"> Of weapons in war, i.e. <hi rend="ital">an attack</hi>: in collatu, <hi rend="ital">in the affray</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 31.—</sense><sense id="n9030.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contributing</hi>, trop., <hi rend="ital">to knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teaching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus collatu aliquid discere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collaudabilis: <entryFree id="n9031" type="hapax" key="collauda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collaudābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>collaudo</etym>, <sense id="n9031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of praise in every respect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 694</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collaudatio: <entryFree id="n9032" type="main" key="collauda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collaudātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warm praise</hi> (perh. only in the foll. exs.; only in the <case>abl.</case>): <cit><quote lang="la">scriptoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:43:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 43, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 9, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collaudator: <entryFree id="n9033" type="hapax" key="collauda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collaudātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who praises warmly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo collaudatore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Con. 4:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Con. 4, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
collaudo: <entryFree id="n9034" type="main" key="collaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-laudo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to praise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commend very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extol highly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quantis laudibus Suum erum servus collaudavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios, se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omnibus conlaudāri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: me, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collaudati milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 52, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem multum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:38" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:490" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 490</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis utrumque collaudandum videri, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collaudo consilium et probo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta et virtutes tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementiam ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum benevolentiam erga se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48, 4 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
collaxo: <entryFree id="n9035" type="main" key="collaxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-laxo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = rarefacio, <foreign lang="greek">xauno/w</foreign>, <sense id="n9035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make loose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">porous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia circum lateramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 233</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:3:20" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collecta: <entryFree id="n9036" type="main" key="collecta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collecta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (orig. <pos>adj.</pos>, sc. pecunia) [colligo]. <sense id="n9036.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contribution in money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a convivā exigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:57:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 57, 233</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 66</bibl> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n9036.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A meeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assemblage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108</bibl></cit>, n. 19.</sense></entryFree>
collectaculum: <entryFree id="n9037" type="main" key="collecta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collectācŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place of assembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a receptacle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reservoir</hi>: aquae, Innocent. Cas. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> p. 230 Goes. vesicae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collectaneus: <entryFree id="n9038" type="main" key="collecta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collectānĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gathered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">collected together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collectaneous</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dicta collectanea, the title of a work of Cæsar, now lost,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl></cit> (perh. his <foreign lang="greek">*)apofqe/gmata</foreign>, mentioned by Cic., Fam. 9, 16, 4).—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Collectānĕa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, the title of the collected works of Jul. Solinus.</sense></entryFree>
collectarius: <entryFree id="n9039" type="main" key="collecta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collectārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a money-changer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cashier</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:49 al" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 49 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
collecte: <entryFree id="n9040" type="main" key="collecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collectē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. colligo <sense id="n9040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
collecticius: <entryFree id="n9041" type="main" key="collecti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collectĭcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>colligo</etym>, <sense id="n9041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">collected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gathered together</hi> (very rare): exercitus, <hi rend="ital">gathered hastily without selection</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>fed by fuel gathered here and there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:23:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collectim: <entryFree id="n9042" type="hapax" key="collectim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collectim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">summarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redigere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 3, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collectio: <entryFree id="n9043" type="main" key="collecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collectĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n9043.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a collecting together.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9043.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum (Absyrti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27:section=25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27, § 25</bibl></cit>: terrae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96, 17</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n9043.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the collecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquiring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum (opp. detractio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9043.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9043.4" n="a" level="4"> In rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">a summing up of things said</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a short repetition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recapitulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summary</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)nakefalai/wsis</foreign>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:302" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 88, 302</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9043.5" n="b" level="4"> In post-Aug. philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">argumentation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reasoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a syllogism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a conclusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inference</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 45:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 45, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:85:2" default="NO">85, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:103" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9043.6" n="II" level="1"> Concr. in medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">a swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abscess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 58, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 4, 7, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:127" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 12, 79, § 127</bibl>; 27, 12, 87, § 110 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 68:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 68, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 206" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 206</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collectitius: <entryFree id="n9044" type="main" key="collecti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collectītĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. collecticius.</entryFree>
collectivus: <entryFree id="n9045" type="main" key="collecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collectīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>colligo</etym>. * <sense id="n9045.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Collected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gathered together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9045.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9045.2" n="A" level="2"> In the rehet. lang. of Quint., <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a syllogism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">syllogistic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ratiocinatire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:66" default="NO">3, 6, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9045.3" n="B" level="2"> In the lang. of grammar: nomen, <pb n="366" /> <cb n="COLL" /> <hi rend="ital">a collective noun;</hi> as exercitus, populus, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 581</bibl> P. al.</sense></entryFree>
collector: <entryFree id="n9046" type="hapax" key="collector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lector</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-student</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collectus: <entryFree id="n9047" type="main" key="collectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. colligo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9048" type="main" key="collectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. colligo</etym>, <sense id="n9048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a collection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 414</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae pluvialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Limit. p. 43" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Limit. p. 43</bibl></cit> Goes.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri et argenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
