collega: <entryFree id="n9049" type="main" key="colle_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lēga</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. lego</etym>. <sense id="n9049.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who is chosen at the same time with another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegae, qui una lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 66</bibl></cit> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9049.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a partner in office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colleague</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bis una consules, collegae in censurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pericles cum haberet collegam in praeturā Sophoclem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in consulatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 45, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 85</bibl></cit>: ibi M. Marcellum, conlegam nostrum, conveni, Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se consulatui ejus destinavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9049.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of an associate in other than official position, <hi rend="ital">a colleague</hi>, <hi rend="ital">associate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metrodorus, Epicuri collega sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 114</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a fellow-member of a club</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sodalitia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 2, 7</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a joint-guardian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 13</bibl> and 45; <hi rend="ital">fellow-slaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 10</bibl> and 30; <hi rend="ital">a fellow-actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:197" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 197</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">joint-heirs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42" default="NO">42</bibl> and 46 al.</sense></entryFree>
collegatarius: <entryFree id="n9050" type="main" key="colle_ga_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lēgātārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a person to whom is bequeathed a legacy in common with others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a collegatary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joint-legatee</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, § 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 2, 10</bibl> and 30.</sense></entryFree>
collegialis: <entryFree id="n9051" type="main" key="colle_gi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collēgĭālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>collegium</etym>, <sense id="n9051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">collegial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">FIDES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 322, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collegiarius: <entryFree id="n9052" type="main" key="colle_gi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collēgĭārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">collegial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collegiatus: <entryFree id="n9053" type="main" key="colle_gi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collēgĭātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who is with one in a society</hi>, <hi rend="ital">college</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corporation</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 17</bibl>: De collegiatis, Cod. Th. 6, 30, 16; 7, 20, 12, § 3; so also <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3948 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
collegium: <entryFree id="n9054" type="main" key="colle_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collēgĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>); in inscrr. sometimes corrupted <itype>COLLEGIVS, ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2413</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4101 al.</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>collega</etym>. <sense id="n9054.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">the connection of associates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colleagues</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">colleagueship</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ita, quae nostra officia fuerunt, pro collegio et pro propinquitate et vivo et mortuo ei praestitimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Cic. Fam. 4, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Decium, expertum mihi concordi collegio virum, mecum consulem faciatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>. 13; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 3</bibl>, and 24, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">magister equitum ex collegio prioris anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 17, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 18, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Decius consul per tot collegia expertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9054.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliatur (noctuis) accipiter conlegio quodam naturae,</quote> <trans><tr>association</tr>, <tr>partnership</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 17, 19, § 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 161</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9054.2" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">persons united by the same office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calling</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">living by some common rules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a college</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corporation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">society</hi>, <hi rend="ital">union</hi>, <hi rend="ital">company</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraternity</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">e(tairi/a, sunarxi/a</foreign> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">nulla (erat) Romae societas vectigalium, nullum collegium aut concilium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunorum plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:41:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 41, § 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontificum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Flavialium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:1 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 1 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurialium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerariūm fabrūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambubaiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: tribuni ... pro collegio pronuntiant, <hi rend="ital">in the name of the</hi> (<hi rend="ital">tribunitial</hi>) <hi rend="ital">college</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 26, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 12</bibl>, and ex collegii sententiā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 53, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collema: <entryFree id="n9055" type="greek" key="colle_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/llhma</foreign>, <sense id="n9055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is glued</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cemented together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruticis Niloticae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colleprosus: <entryFree id="n9056" type="hapax" key="collepro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-leprōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-leper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colleticus: <entryFree id="n9057" type="greek" key="colle_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kollhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for gluing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sticking together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clysteria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colletis: <entryFree id="n9058" type="greek" key="colle_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collētis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kollhti/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collevo: <entryFree id="n9059" type="main" key="colle_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lēvo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">con-</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-laevo</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="COLL" /> <hi rend="ital">make entirely smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smooth</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">plagam arboris falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitatem oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 64:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 64, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">interanea vesicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 18, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colliberta: <entryFree id="n9060" type="gloss" key="colli_berta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collīberta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellowfreedwoman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 575</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3927</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collibertus: <entryFree id="n9061" type="main" key="colli_bertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lībertus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellowfreedman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:59:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 59, § 154</bibl> dub.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:18 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 3, 18 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
collibet: <entryFree id="n9062" type="main" key="colli^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lĭbet</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">collŭbet</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>buit or bītum est, 2</itype>, <sense id="n9062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it pleases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is agreeable</hi> (very rare, and only in the pret. tenses); in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: si collibuisset, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl>: quae victoribus conlubuissent, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 9</bibl>; in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque animo conlubitum est meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 187</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid conlubitum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 26</bibl></cit> Fleck.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2, 13, p. 180</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
collibro: <entryFree id="n9063" type="hapax" key="colli_bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lībro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to measure off.</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 19, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">bis.</hi></sense></entryFree>
collicellus: <entryFree id="n9064" type="main" key="colli^cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collĭcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>collis</etym>, <sense id="n9064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very little hill</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Agrim.</author> p. 245</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">272</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
colliciae: <entryFree id="n9065" type="main" key="colli^ciae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lĭciae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">collĭquĭae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>con-liquor, a flowing together; hence</etym>, <sense id="n9065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">channels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drains</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gutters for conducting water in the fields</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon the roofs of buildings</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=114:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 114, 4</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
colliciaris: <entryFree id="n9066" type="hapax" key="colli^ci^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lĭcĭāris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>colliciae</etym>, <sense id="n9066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to water-channels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegula,</quote> <trans><tr>a roof-tile</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colliculus: <entryFree id="n9067" type="main" key="colli^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>collis</etym>, <sense id="n9067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little hill</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, 1, p. 340</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collido: <entryFree id="n9068" type="main" key="colli_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-līdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>līsi, līsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>laedo</etym>, <sense id="n9068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">press together</hi>, etc. (rare; mostly post-Aug.; most freq. in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n9068.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">umor ita mollis est, ut facile premi collidique possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 532</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collidere manus,</quote> <trans><tr>to clap</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes colliduntur,</quote> <trans><tr>chatter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus ut fiat, primo colliditur aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare inter se navigia collidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:16" default="NO">9, 9, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis uterque colliditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvam sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 855</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum factum, si fractum vel collisum est, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>bruised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:14" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 14</bibl>; freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">battered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beaten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bruised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentea vasa collisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:22:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: os, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 223</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collisa,</quote> <trans><tr>bruised limbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 33</bibl></cit>; cf. Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 217</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9068.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring into collision</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into hostile contact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set at variance;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become hostile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be at variance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contend</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ambitiosa pios collidit gloria fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:435" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 435</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:45" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 45</bibl>: Graecia barbariae lento collisa duello, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collisa inter se duo rei publicae capita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si binae (consonantes) collidantur,</quote> <trans><tr>come in contact</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colliduntur aut pares (leges) inter se aut secum ipsae,</quote> <trans><tr>conflict with one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:2 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:32" default="NO">5, 7, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colliga: <entryFree id="n9069" type="main" key="colli^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collĭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. colligo</etym>, <sense id="n9069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place for gathering nitrum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 113</bibl> Jan. (Sillig, colycas).</sense></entryFree>
colligate: <entryFree id="n9070" type="main" key="colli^ga_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collĭgātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), v. 2. colligo <sense id="n9070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
colligatio: <entryFree id="n9071" type="main" key="colli^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collĭgātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. colligo</etym>, <sense id="n9071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connection</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n9071.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his colligationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota operis colligatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quattuor (elementa),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9071.2" n="B" level="2"> In mechanics, <hi rend="ital">a ligature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fastening</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9071.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">causarum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:56:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 56, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colligatione naturali omnia fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:14:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artior societatis propinquorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colligo: <entryFree id="n9072" type="main" key="colli^go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lĭgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>lēgi, lectum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n9072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.a.</hi> [2. lego, ĕre], <hi rend="ital">to gather</hi> or <hi rend="ital">collect together into a whole</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to a point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assemble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect</hi> (class. and very freq.), </sense><sense id="n9072.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9072.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n9072.3" n="1" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia praesegmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: omnia furtim, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 273, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices palmarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes in vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiem nostram Post obitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:847" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 847</bibl></cit> (and Hom. Il. 24, 793): <cit><quote lang="la">sparsos per colla capillos in nodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 319</bibl>; <cb n="COLL" /> and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf. to the person: <cit><quote lang="la">immissos hederā collecta capillos Calliope, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:338" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 338</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sinus fluentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">riguo horto olus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:646" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de purpureis vitibus uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:676" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: omnia venena, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmenta virgultaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naufragium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: mortualia, glossaria conlegitis et lexidia, res taetras et inanes, Domit. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viatica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stipem a tyrannis,</quote> <trans><tr>to obtain by begging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 45, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër umorem colligens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pluvias aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:109" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5" default="NO">5</bibl>. 14, 31: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus per loca subcava terrae Collectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 26, § 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatus cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:390" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collectae ex alto nubes,</quote> <trans><tr>heaped together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis collectus turbine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 31</bibl></cit>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulverem Olympicum Collegisse juvat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to have covered himself with it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna revertentes colligit ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqua verba et figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <trans><tr>to check</tr>, <tr>restrain</tr>, <tr>stop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 398</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:399" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:695" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 695</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fig. iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:477" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 477</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the operation of medicine: acria viscerum colligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 26, § 85</bibl></cit>: hastas, <hi rend="ital">to draw back</hi> (opp. protendere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum,</quote> <trans><tr>to catch a falling book</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatu nobis (sc. oratoribus) opus est et rebus exquisitis, undique collectis, arcessitis, comportatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">interea, dum haec, quae dispersa sunt, cogantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 191</bibl></cit>: sarcinas; <hi rend="ital">to pack one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s luggage</hi> for a journey: <cit><quote lang="la">annus octogesimus admonet me, ut sarcinas colligam ante quam proficiscar e vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; also: sarcinas conligere = sarcinas conferre, <hi rend="ital">to gather and put in order the baggage of an army</hi> before a battle, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 4</bibl>: vasa, milit. t. t.., <hi rend="ital">to pack together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pack up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break up the camp</hi> for a march, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:19:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 19, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 47, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 30, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma = remos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to take in hand</tr>, <tr>take up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 15</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n9072.4" n="2" level="3"> Of persons, mostly milit., <hi rend="ital">to collect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assemble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus collectus ex senibus desperatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex urbe, ex agris, numerum hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos ex fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu collectā in Thraciam introiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pagis omnibus bonos viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: se colligere, <hi rend="ital">to gather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:390" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex regno alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: ad. aciem, Auct. B. Afr. 70; so, collecti, <hi rend="ital">those who have collected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aestuaria ac paludes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9072.5" n="B" level="2"> Esp., with the accessory idea of shortening, by bringing together, <hi rend="ital">to contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concentrate</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for the more usual contraho, coërceo, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">in spiram tractu se colligit anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 154</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cogebantur breviore spatio et ipsi orbem colligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alitis in parvae subitam collecta figuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:862" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 862</bibl></cit> Wagn. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apicem collectus in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:910" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 910</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <trans><tr>to compress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumina collecta in artum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>: se collegit in arma, <hi rend="ital">covered himself with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concealed himself behind his shield</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 491</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 412</bibl> (post scutum se clausit, Serv.; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sustalei\s e)n a)spi/di, e)p) a)spi/dos</foreign>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:545" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 545</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:255" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:129" default="NO">10, 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <trans><tr>to gather up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:33:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">12, 48, 5: per vulnera colligit hostes,</quote> <trans><tr>causes them to retreat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:3" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9072.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="dom">Medic. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thicken</hi> (cf. cogo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 95" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:129" default="NO">129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:138" default="NO">138</bibl>; 169; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 27, § 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9072.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9072.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sescentae ad eam rem causae possunt conligi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conlectis omnibus bellis civilibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>brought together in speaking</tr>, <tr>adduced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammarum iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 723</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:335" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 335</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multaque facete dicta, ut ea, quae a sene Catone collecta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 42, 191</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res undique conlectae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam conlecta edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:120" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsa argumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: antiqua verba, Suet. <pb n="367" /> <cb n="COLL" /> Gram. 10: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes rumorum et contionum ventos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumorem bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata consulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia Pythagoreorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimationem multo sudore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:22:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 22, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiam civium blanditiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam gratiam magnamque dignitatem ex hoc labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl></cit> (16), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam clementiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 48, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum amoris favorisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 14, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam crudelitatis ex eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:8:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 8, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina majestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:33" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 327</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 446</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 341</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adducere sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 13</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 234</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 212</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum patiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 339</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 30, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:307" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 307</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9072.9" n="b" level="4"> Of number, distance, etc., <hi rend="ital">to amount</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend; pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be reckoned</hi> (rare, and only in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ut LX. passus plerique (rami) orbe colligant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus per frontem centum duos pedes colligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 12, 17, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quos (consules) a regno Numae colliguntur anni DXXXV.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 85</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9072.10" n="B" level="2"> Colligere se or animum, mentem, etc., <hi rend="ital">to collect one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to compose one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recover one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolution</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid est autem se ipsum colligere, nisi dissipatas animi partes rursum in suum locum cogere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:36:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 36, 78</bibl></cit>: se, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:925" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 925</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se colligere,</quote> <trans><tr>to rally</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B.G. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex timore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B.C. 3, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 41, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum cogitationemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 352</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem cum vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim mente collectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">colligere spiritum,</quote> <trans><tr>to take breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9072.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To gather up in memory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put together in the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to think upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et nostrae rei publicae detrimenta considero, et maximarum civitatum veteres animo calamitates colligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut memineris, quae, etc.... quae, si colliges, et sperabis omnia optime, et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis haec insania quantas Virtutes habeat, sic collige,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 119</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic collige mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 51</bibl></cit>. —Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n9072.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To put together mentally</hi>, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">to gather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infer from what precedes</hi> (most freq. in Quint.); constr.: aliquid, aliquid ex aliquā re, per aliquam rem, aliquā re.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo colligere potes, quantā occupatione distinear,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:3" default="NO">7, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:6" default="NO">7, 8, 6</bibl>; 8, 4, 16; 4, 4, 5 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 67</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">per</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid per aliud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 81</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case> without a <pos>prep.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod multis et acutis conclusionibus colligunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:14" default="NO">5, 13, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:37" default="NO">6, 3, 37</bibl>; 7, 4, 1 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:2 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3, 2 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">inde</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucitatem inde hostium colligentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene colligit, haec pueris et mulierculis esse grata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque hoc colligi desideramus, disertiores esse antiquos, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:18" default="NO">7, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:42" default="NO">1, 10, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 380</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:85" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 85</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9072.13" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">collectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">contracted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrow</hi> (opp. effusus): <cit><quote lang="la">tanto beatior, quanto collectior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 21, p. 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora collectiora (opp. effusiora),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Flacc. Decl. 2, p. 795</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus collectius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">collectē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">summarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strictly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere aliquod verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 164, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9072.14" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">collectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is collected</hi> as food, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 60, § 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9073" type="main" key="colli^go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lĭgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fasten together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to connect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie up</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n9073.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">omne colligatum solvi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora colligata vinculis naturalibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13</bibl>: vasa (of warlike implements; cf. the preced. art., I. A. 1. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 25</bibl>, and the common expression in the formula: i, lictor, colliga manus, <hi rend="ital">tie the prisoner</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 8</bibl>: conligavit eum miseris modis, Ter. <cb n="COLL" /> Eun. 5, 4, 33: <cit><quote lang="la">pluribus scutis uno ictu pilorum transfixis et colligatis,</quote> <trans><tr>fastened to one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum herbis colligatum,</quote> <trans><tr>thickly overgrown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bitumen vulnera colligat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 181</bibl></cit>; cf.: colligatis vulneribus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9073.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9073.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to unite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connect</hi> (rare except in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">homines inter se sermonis vinclo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum genera inter se colligata atque implicata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(res) omnes inter se aptae colligataeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias verbis,</quote> <trans><tr>to join together rhetorically</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:50:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 50, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annorum septingentorum memoriam uno libro,</quote> <trans><tr>to comprehend</tr>, <tr>comprise</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34, 120</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9073.4" n="B" level="2"> With the access. idea of preventing free motion, <hi rend="ital">to restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum furentis (Antonii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brutum in Graeciā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to command that he remain there for protection</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cum multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">collĭgātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">connectedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jointly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colligatius adhaerere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doct. Christ. 1:28" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doct. Christ. 1, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collimitaneus: <entryFree id="n9074" type="hapax" key="colli_mi^ta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-līmĭtānĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n9074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bordering upon;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygia Galatiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collimitium: <entryFree id="n9075" type="main" key="colli_mi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-līmĭtĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>limes</etym>, <sense id="n9075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the boundary between two countries</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 49, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collimitia Romana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collimito: <entryFree id="n9076" type="main" key="colli_mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-līmĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">collī-mĭtor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n9076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to border upon</hi> (post-class. and very rare); with <case>dat.</case>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collimo: <entryFree id="n9077" type="main" key="collimo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collimo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, false read. for collineo, āre.</entryFree>
collina: <entryFree id="n9078" type="main" key="colli_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>collinus</etym>, <sense id="n9078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hilly land</hi>, Innoc. de Cas. Litt. p. 224 Goes.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9079" type="main" key="Colli_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Collīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">goddess of hills</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8 (others read Collatina).</sense></entryFree>
collineo: <entryFree id="n9080" type="main" key="colli_ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-līnĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to direct something in a straight line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to aim</hi> (rare, and except in Cic. only postclass.). </sense><sense id="n9080.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam aut sagittam aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: manum et oculos, Julian. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos ad umbram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 237</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 23</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n9080.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take a right aim</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 121</bibl>; cf. Madv. Fin. p. 382.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">collīnĕātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in a direct line;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artistically;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Alex. M. 3:48" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Alex. M. 3, 48</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:ib. 3:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collino: <entryFree id="n9081" type="main" key="colli^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>lēvi, lĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to besmear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pollute</hi>: aliquid, aliquā re (rare; not in class. prose). </sense><sense id="n9081.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ora venenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas cerā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: crines adulteros pulvere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 20</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedare in pulvere crines): caeno collitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9081.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchrum ornatum turpes mores pejus caeno collinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collinus: <entryFree id="n9082" type="main" key="colli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>collis</etym>, <sense id="n9082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a hill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found</hi> or <hi rend="ital">growing on a hill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hill-</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n9082.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus agrorum (opp. to campestre and montanum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9082.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Collīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the hills in the northeastern part of Rome</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the Quirinal and Viminal</hi>), <hi rend="ital">Colline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio urbis Collina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, § 56; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 13</bibl>.—Hence, Porta Collina, <hi rend="ital">the gate in Rome near the Quirinal Hill</hi> (called also Agonensis and Quirinalis Porta; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=332" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 332</bibl> Müll.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 57, 2</bibl>; 26, 10, 3; 40, 34, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:871" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 871</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 549</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <trans><tr>growing in the vicinity of this gate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 11; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">turris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:291" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 291</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colliphium: <entryFree id="n9083" type="main" key="colli_phi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collīphĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. coliphium.</entryFree>
colliquefactus: <entryFree id="n9084" type="main" key="colli^que^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lĭquĕfactus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [liquefio], <sense id="n9084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made fluid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liquefied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melted</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">glacies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: venenum in potione, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colliquesco: <entryFree id="n9085" type="main" key="colli^quesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lĭquesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>lĭqui, ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become fluid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to liquefy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolve</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n9085.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: cum aurum colliquisset, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 334, 27 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aes colliquisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> (but Neue, Formenl. 2, 486, would read collicuisset in both these passages): <cit><quote lang="la">in pice colliquescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:22:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 306, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9085.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cb n="COLL" /> lacrimis, <hi rend="ital">to melt into tears</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Nep. Am. 2" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Nep. Am. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colliquiae: <entryFree id="n9086" type="main" key="colli^qui^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collĭquĭae</orth>, v. colliciae.</entryFree>
collis: <entryFree id="n9087" type="main" key="collis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> reg. colle, e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 698</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 333</bibl>; 14, 822; 14, 836; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 3</bibl>: <sense id="n9087.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Aventino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">colli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 317</bibl></cit> and 322; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 466</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> collium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37</bibl>; Lact. Opif. Dei, 10), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cel-, root of ex-cello, celsus; cf. calamus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">high ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hill</hi> (opp. mons and campus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1373</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 555</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Palatinum Capitolinumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 54, 3 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianae, i.e. Aventinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, = mons: <cit><quote lang="la">collis Heliconii cultor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 1</bibl></cit>.—And in <number>plur.</number>: colles, for <hi rend="ital">a chain of mountains</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:420" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 420</bibl>.—Hence, Ital. <hi rend="ital">collina;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">colline.</hi></sense></entryFree>
collisio: <entryFree id="n9088" type="main" key="colli_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collīsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>collido</etym>, <sense id="n9088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dashing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">striking together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a concussion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partūs abjecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:12:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9088.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of letters in a word: <foreign lang="greek">pnei=n, xei)n, r(ei=n</foreign>, non sunt integra, sed ex collisione contracta. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Diff. 19, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collisus: <entryFree id="n9089" type="main" key="colli_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collīsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from collido.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9090" type="main" key="colli_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collīsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>collido</etym>, <sense id="n9090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collision</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">margaritarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collitus: <entryFree id="n9091" type="main" key="colli^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from collino.</entryFree>
collocatio: <entryFree id="n9092" type="main" key="collo^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collŏcātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>colloco</etym>, <sense id="n9092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a setting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collocation</hi> (except in rhet. use, very rare). </sense><sense id="n9092.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9092.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. in speech: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">70, 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. § 6; 8, 3, 41; 9, 4, 58; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 4, 89: argumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:42:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 42, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9092.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: filiae, <hi rend="ital">an endowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">giving in marriage</hi> (v. colloco, I. B.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 190</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
