colloco: <entryFree id="n9093" type="main" key="collo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lŏco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a thing</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">person</hi>) <hi rend="ital">somewhere</hi> (class. in prose and poetry; cf.: statuo, pono, sisto). </sense><sense id="n9093.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9093.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.; constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (cf. Ramsh. Gr. p. 467 sq.; Zumpt, Gr. § 489); more rarely with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> also with other prepositions, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9093.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">istam conloca cruminam in collo plane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rostris collocati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in cubili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in custodiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in solitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno quidque in loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculem in concilio caelestium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones in cervicibus nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 27, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem in eis locis hiemandi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in hibernis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me in gremio Veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem grabati In collo sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias bipertito in silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (copias) in convalle in insidiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem in latebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:424 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 424 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas bene pictas in bono lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremo In monte saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:68" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus in vestibulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia in litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—With locat. proper names; <cit><quote lang="la">of towns: classem Miseni et alteram Ravennae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulas cohortes, Puteolis et Ostiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se Athenis collocavit,</quote> <trans><tr>established himself</tr>, <tr>settled there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—So also with <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupato oppido, ibi praesidium collocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi iste castra collocarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:37:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 37, § 96</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9093.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabernam vasa et servos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me in arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam in lectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 45</bibl></cit> (ipsum verbum collocant proprium est, et ascribitur pronubis, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in provinciam hiemandi gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">supra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl></cit>, and 3, 29; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18</bibl>, B. 1. infra: <cit><quote lang="la">maxilla ubi in suam sedem collocata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9093.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos pennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 723</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9093.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With other prepositions (freq. in Suet.): comites apud ceteros hospites, <hi rend="ital">to lodge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarter</hi>, Cic. Verr. <pb n="368" /> <cb n="COLL" /> 2, 1, 24, § <cit><quote lang="la">63: ut ante suum fundum Miloni insidias conlocaret,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay an ambush for</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mil. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortis legionarias quattuor advorsum pedites hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones propius Armeniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse propior montem suos conlocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides super se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulas infra se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 9</bibl></cit>, consulares super pulpitum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticam pro tribunali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 33</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: sine tumultu praesidiis conlocatis: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 45, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulis et signis propalam collocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnas neque rectas, neque e regione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticae collocabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes ac domicilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam impedimenta collocata animadvertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 37, 1</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere impedimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 36, 6</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">chlamydem, ut pendeat apte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collocat hasta sues,</quote> <trans><tr>lays prostrate</tr>, <tr>kills</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:65:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 65, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua signa in subsidio (i. e. ad subsidium) artius conlocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum exercitum in subsidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 5 Kritz <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, bonae feminae, collocate puellulam (cf. B. 1. infra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9093.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9093.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give in marriage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 27</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 26, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 22 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem homini nobilissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam in matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">together with in matrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:77" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam in se dignam condicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sororem ex matre et propinquas suas nuptum in alias civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nuptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl>.—Less freq. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arist. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in collocandā filiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collocantis filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9093.9" n="2" level="3"> Collocare pecuniam, dotem, faenus, etc., a mercantile t. t., <hi rend="ital">to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dowry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wealth</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem herilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eā provinciā pecunias magnas collocatas habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias in emptiones praediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias graviore faenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curavit, ut in eo fundo dos collocaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam posse eam (pecuniam) melius conlocari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas patrimonii partes in solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">duas faenoris partes in agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam idoneis nominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:88" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 88</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n9093.10" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to employ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invest</hi> money in some way: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium suum non effudit: in rei publicae salute collocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miliens sestertium eā munificentiā collocatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9093.11" n="3" level="3"> (Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">protiqe/nai.</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">To lay out a dead body in state in the</hi> vestibulum: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sancte ac reverenter in hortis Domitiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. p. 5</bibl></cit>; v. Casaub. ad h. l.—</sense><sense id="n9093.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (in good prose; most freq. in Cic. and Quint.). </sense><sense id="n9093.13" n="A" level="2"> In gen., acc. to I. A., <hi rend="ital">to place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispose of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9093.14" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum multa in pectore suo conlocare oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res est videnda in tuto ut conlocetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut totos se in optimo vitae statu exquirendo collocarent,</quote> <trans><tr>employed</tr>, <tr>occupied themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totum se in cognitione et scientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:158" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 44, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese palam in meretriciā vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam in urbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animis ego vestris omnes triumphos meos condi et collocari volo,</quote> <trans><tr>to be placed</tr>, <tr>deposited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne suum studium in doctrinā ac sapientiā,</quote> <trans><tr>to apply</tr>, <tr>employ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:10:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 10, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem in incerto reliqui temporis eventu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 26, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentiam suam in amore et voluptatibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to employ</tr>, <tr>spend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonas horas male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:113:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 113, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium longitudinum et brevitatum in sonis judicium ipsa natura in auribus nostris collocavit,</quote> <trans><tr>placed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:173" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam in tuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9093.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in otium se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines quattuor In soporem,</quote> <trans><tr>to put into the sleep of death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9093.16" n="(g)" level="5"> With simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">et propriis verbis et ordine collocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordine collocati sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9093.17" n="(d)" level="5"> With other prepositions: est et in nominibus<cb n="COLL" />  ex diverso collocatis sua gratia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 86</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to set in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem militarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedilitas recte collocata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuā nobis auctoritate opus est ad collocandum aliquem civitatis statum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 15, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix ut iis rebus, quas constituissent, conlocandis atque administrandis tempus daretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: omnibus rebus confectis et collocatis, Auct. B. Alex. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—In rhet.: verba collocata, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in their relative positions</hi> (opp. simplicia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:80 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 24, 80 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut apte collocentur (verba),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 26; cf. id. § 31; 10, 2, 13; 8, 1, 1; 10. 1, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 4, 1 al. —Rare: de cujus moderatione... in prioribus libris satis collocavi (= scripsi, dixi),</quote> <trans><tr>have brought forward</tr>, <tr>put forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9093.18" n="B" level="2"> Acc. to I. B. 2.: quamobrem melius apud bonos quam apud fortunatos beneficium collocari puto, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">at interest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:22:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 22, § 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pecuniae non quaerendae solum ratio est, verum etiam conlocandae... sic gloria et quaerenda et conlocanda ratione est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collocupleto: <entryFree id="n9094" type="main" key="collo^cu^ple_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lŏcŭplēto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make very rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enrich</hi> (prob. only in the foll. exs.). </sense><sense id="n9094.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9094.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to embellish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enrich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei honestandae et collocupletandae causā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 18, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collocutio: <entryFree id="n9095" type="main" key="collo^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collŏcūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>colloquor</etym>, <sense id="n9095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (<hi rend="ital">familiar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">private</hi>) <hi rend="ital">conversation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conference</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire cum aliquo in collocutionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 15, 25</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiarissimae cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sermonibus collocutionibusque aliquid videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collocutor: <entryFree id="n9096" type="main" key="collo^cu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collŏcūtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who talks with another</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colloquium: <entryFree id="n9097" type="main" key="collo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collŏquĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conversation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi> (class. in prose and poetry; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Hor.): colloquium cum conveniunt in unum locum loquendi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 57</bibl></cit> Müll.; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 256, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo ad colloquium venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in colloquium venire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Antonii congressum colloquiumque veniendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervenire ad conloquium alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denos ut ad colloquium adducerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquā re in colloquium venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenire in colloquium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in colloquio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: facere, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulta habere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">secreta serere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 61, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnis impellere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">secretis componere, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebra inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 552</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausis foribus videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 32: <cit><quote lang="la">colloquio alterius non egere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">colloquio carere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adesse colloquiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:293" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum leviorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruiturque deorum Colloquio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloquia amicorum absentium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>epistolary correspondence</tr>, <tr>communication by letter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9097.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to animals: <cit><quote lang="la">alitum colloquia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 49, 70, § 137</bibl></cit>; repeated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colloquor: <entryFree id="n9098" type="main" key="collo^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lŏquor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>cūtus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n9098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to talk together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">converse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold a conversation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a parley</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">a conference</hi> (in good prose); constr. commonly <hi rend="ital">cum aliquo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> in Plaut. several times as <hi rend="ital">verb act.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n9098.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum aliquo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:218" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo per aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo per litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9098.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc uno praestamus vel maxime feris, quod colloquimur inter nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum inter se usque ad extremum tempus diei conlocuti sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 41, 90</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 56; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se multum de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9098.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde utrique imperatores colloquuntur simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 10</bibl>; id. <cb n="COLL" /> Eun. 2, 3, 76; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8</bibl> (10), 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:24 al" default="NO">8, 13, 24 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9098.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te volo, uxor, colloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de his rebus, quas tecum colloqui volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collubet: <entryFree id="n9099" type="main" key="collu^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collŭbet</orth>, v. collibet.</entryFree>
collubus: <entryFree id="n9100" type="main" key="collu^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collŭbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. collybus.</entryFree>
colluceo: <entryFree id="n9101" type="main" key="collu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lūcĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give light on every side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shine brightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wholly illuminated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be bright</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi> (class. in prose and poetry; not in Hor.). </sense><sense id="n9101.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9101.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol, qui tam longe lateque colluceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum conlucet omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: taeda per undas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:883" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 883</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collucent ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 166</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 567</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampades undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumae ignium modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 47, 67, § 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9101.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabri fulgore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:32:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 32, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignibus aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra fulgore ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polus ignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:89" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia luminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus veste atque insignibus armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 539</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9101.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Ab aliquā re</hi> (cf. ab, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">(mare), quā a sole collucet, albescit et vibrat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9101.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be resplendent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi collucere omnia furtis tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:22:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 22, § 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collucent floribus agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:363" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 363</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:293" default="NO">10, 293</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collucesco: <entryFree id="n9102" type="main" key="collu_cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lūcesco</orth>, <itype>colluxi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n9102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lighten up</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">colluxit flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:ad Liv. 1:287" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> ad Liv. 1, 287</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9102.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligible</hi>, Boëth. Syllog. Hypoth. 1, p. 623.</sense></entryFree>
colluco: <entryFree id="n9103" type="main" key="collu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lūco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lux</etym>, <sense id="n9103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thin a forest</hi>, etc.: collucare est succisis arboribus locum luce implere, Fest. s. v. sublucare, p. 348, 18 Müll. (explained in a different manner by Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=37:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 37, 12</bibl> ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">lucum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colluctatio: <entryFree id="n9104" type="main" key="collucta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">colluctātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>colluctor</etym>, <sense id="n9104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struggling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contending with something</hi> (post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n9104.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">in colluctatione vel pancratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the fighting of oxen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9104.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the death struggle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:18:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 18, 1</bibl>. —Of <hi rend="ital">an embracing</hi> in love, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 219, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 17</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a difficult utterance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliis concursus oris et cum verbis suis colluctatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colluctator: <entryFree id="n9105" type="main" key="collucta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">colluctātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, prop. <sense id="n9105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestler;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">an anlagonist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adversary</hi>, Lact. Opif. Dei, 1, 7.</sense></entryFree>
colluctor: <entryFree id="n9106" type="main" key="colluctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-luctor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to struggle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrestle with</hi> (post-Aug. and rare); constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum aliquo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedonibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 523</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:8:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 129</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum petulantiā morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colludium: <entryFree id="n9107" type="main" key="collu_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collūdĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>colludo</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n9107.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sporting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">playing together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphinorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9107.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceptive understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collusion</hi>, esp. in justice, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 1</bibl>; Cod. Th. 9, 42, 20; 11, 42, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:20" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colludo: <entryFree id="n9108" type="main" key="collu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lūdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sport together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play with</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n9108.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: (puer) gestit paribus colludere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 159</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: aut summā nantes in aquā colludere plumas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 369</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">DIGITIS COLLVDENTIBVS TRADERE PECORA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3166</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9108.2" n="II" level="1"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to keep up false appearances with one to the injury of a third person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a secret understanding with one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act collusively</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:24:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 24, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 4, 7, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:5:7" default="NO">41, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:11:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 11, 17</bibl>: cf. collusio and colludium, 2.</sense></entryFree>
collugeo: <entryFree id="n9109" type="main" key="collu_ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lūgĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grieve together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:5:88" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 5, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collum: <entryFree id="n9110" type="main" key="collum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (ante-class. access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">collus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Naev., Cato, Lucil., Att., Caecil., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 200, 14 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 2</bibl>; and, acc. to Non. l. l., also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 289</bibl>: <sense id="n9110.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">nec collos mihi Calvus persuaserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 42</bibl></cit>; Front. Ep. ad M. <pb n="369" /> <cb n="COLL" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 2, 16</bibl>) [cf. Germ. Hals]. </sense><sense id="n9110.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the neck</hi>, of men and animals: <cit><quote lang="la">accipite si vultis hoc onus in vostros collos, Cato, l.l.: anseris, Lucil. l.l.: pavonis, Varr. l. l.: columbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 802</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in collum invasit,</quote> <trans><tr>fell upon the neck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: amplexu petebat, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendentia bracchia collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 715</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collo dare bracchia circum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicuit materno bracchia collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloque infusa mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:386" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 386</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:585" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 585</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingere colla lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complecti lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captare lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 8, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adducere lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 625</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiae poenam collo et cervicibus suis sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:42:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 42, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjecta vincula collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:83" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum in laqueum inserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstri angere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:827" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 827</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptare vincula collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla assuescere servitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsori committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9110.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n9110.3" n="a" level="4"> As a symbol of servitude: <cit><quote lang="la">dare colla triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 10, 15: <cit><quote lang="la">eripe turpi Colla jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9110.4" n="b" level="4"> (As in Engl., it costs him his neck, etc.) A symbol of life: <cit><quote lang="la">actum'st de collo meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 194</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">posuit collum in Pulvere Teucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9110.5" n="c" level="4"> Collum torquere, obtorquere, obstringere alicui, legal t. t., <hi rend="ital">to seize by the neck and drag before a tribunal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to prison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam obtorto collo ad praetorem trahor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 45</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obtortā gulā de convivio in vincla abripi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 24</bibl></cit>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9110.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the neck of a flask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bottle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 88, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 26, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:174" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11, 48, § 174</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the poppy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 436</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the middle part of Mount Parnassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:643" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 643</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collumino: <entryFree id="n9111" type="main" key="collu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lūmĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to illuminate on all sides</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 45, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 830</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colluo: <entryFree id="n9112" type="main" key="collu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>lŭi, lūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wash out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rinse</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic.); constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">aliquid aliquā re;</hi> rarely <hi rend="ital">aliquid de aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metretam amurcā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os de oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 38, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decocto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 6, 56, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma melle colluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 155</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: ora, <hi rend="ital">to moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to quench thirst</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 447</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">abluere sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 877</bibl></cit>).—* </sense><sense id="n9112.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wash up</hi> (earth) <hi rend="ital">by the waves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:30:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 30, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collurchinatio: <entryFree id="n9113" type="main" key="collurchi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lurchĭnātĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-lurcĭn-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lurcor</etym>, <sense id="n9113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gross gluttony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gormandizing</hi> (post-class. and rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 322, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
collus: <entryFree id="n9114" type="main" key="collus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. collum.</entryFree>
collusio: <entryFree id="n9115" type="main" key="collu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collūsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>colludo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n9115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceptive understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collusion</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:13:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 13, § 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter raptae patrem et raptorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:11:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per collusionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 5:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 31</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa inter virum et uxorem nota collusio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 322, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de collusione detegendā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:19" default="NO">8, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:8" default="NO">17, 1, 8</bibl>; 12, 2, 30, § 3.</sense></entryFree>
collusor: <entryFree id="n9116" type="main" key="collu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collūsor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>colludo</etym>. <sense id="n9116.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion in play</hi>, <hi rend="ital">playmate</hi> (in good prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 23, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 39, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 13</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 33, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 5, 1, § 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n9116.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to colludo, II.) <hi rend="ital">He who has a secret understanding with one to the injury of a third</hi>, in law, Cod. Th. 7, 20, 2.</sense></entryFree>
collusorie: <entryFree id="n9117" type="hapax" key="collu_so_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collūsōrĭē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>collusor, II.</etym>, <sense id="n9117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a concerted manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collusively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litigare de hereditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:50:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 50, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collustrium: <entryFree id="n9118" type="gloss" key="collustri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collustrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>collustro</etym>, <sense id="n9118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a corporation that procured the lustration of the fields of a district</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1773</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collustro: <entryFree id="n9119" type="main" key="collustro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lustro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lighten on all sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to illumine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brighten</hi> (rare but class.; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n9119.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">sol omnia clarissimā luce collustrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:36:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 36, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl> (al. lustret).—* </sense><sense id="n9119.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: collustrata in picturis, <hi rend="ital">the brilliantly colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi> (opp. opaca), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 11, 36</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9119.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to consider a thing on all sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survey</hi>: omnia oculis, Cic. Tusc. <cb n="COLO" /> 5, 23, 65: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
collutio: <entryFree id="n9120" type="main" key="collu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>colluo</etym>, <sense id="n9120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rinsing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">washing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 53" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:39" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collutito: <entryFree id="n9121" type="hapax" key="collu^ti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">col-lŭtĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>colluo; cf. Ritschl, prol. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> p. 74</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n9121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to soil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile much;</hi> trop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 67</bibl> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 25</bibl> (al. collutulo).</sense></entryFree>
collutus: <entryFree id="n9122" type="main" key="collu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <mood>Part.</mood>, from colluo.</entryFree>
colluviaris: <entryFree id="n9123" type="gloss" key="collu^vi^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collŭvĭāris</orth> <itype>porcus dicitur, qui cibo permixto et colluvie nutritur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57, 8</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
colluvies: <entryFree id="n9124" type="main" key="collu^vi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collŭvĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ēi</itype>, v. colluvio.</entryFree>
colluvio: <entryFree id="n9125" type="main" key="collu^vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collŭvĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">collŭvĭ-es</orth>, <itype>em, ē</itype> (the latter form not freq. before the Aug. per.; but exclusively used by Col., Pliny the elder, and Tac.; a third collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">collŭvĭum</orth>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Diff. Verb. 40</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>colluo</etym>, <sense id="n9125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conflux</hi> or <hi rend="ital">collection of filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">washings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweepings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swill.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9125.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9125.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Colluvies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:22:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 22, 1</bibl>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">2 and 4: cohortis et aedificii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:6" default="NO">1, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbida nigro limo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 311</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 116, § 176</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9125.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Colluvio: <cit><quote lang="la">colluvionibus sentinarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9125.4" n="II" level="1"> More freq. trop., <hi rend="ital">the impure conflux of different objects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dregs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impurities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impure mixture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile medley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offscourings.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9125.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Colluvio: <cit><quote lang="la">mixtorum omnis generis animantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex hac turbā et colluvione discedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 82, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o praeclarum diem, omnium scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deterrima verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colluvionem gentium adferre,</quote> <trans><tr>a polluting mixture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixti ex omni colluvione exsules obaerati, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 40, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 43, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in colluvione Drusi,</quote> <trans><tr>the dregs of the people adhering to him</tr>, <tr>the rabble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Vat. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cod. Th. 13, 3, 7: ordinum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis peregrini et servilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9125.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Colluvies, Atticus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collecta populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colluvium: <entryFree id="n9126" type="main" key="collu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collŭvĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conl-</orth>), v. colluvio.</entryFree>
collybista: <entryFree id="n9127" type="greek" key="colly^bista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collybista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kollubisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a money-changer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 21, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collybus: <entryFree id="n9128" type="greek" key="colly^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collybus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">collŭbus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/llubos</foreign> [prob. of Phoenicio-Semitic origin, kindr. with the Heb. <foreign />, to change], <sense id="n9128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the exchange of coins of different kinds</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">of different countries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agio.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9128.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 6, 1</bibl>; Cassiod. Parm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9128.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the rate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">premium of exchange</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:78:section=181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 78, § 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
collyra: <entryFree id="n9129" type="greek" key="colly_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collȳra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kollu/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n9129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pastry of a round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elongated form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maccaroni</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vermicelli</hi>, shred into broth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 12</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9129.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">collȳrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of vermicelli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vermicelli soup</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 15</bibl> and 17.</sense></entryFree>
collyriolum: <entryFree id="n9130" type="hapax" key="colly_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collȳrĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>collyrium</etym>, <sense id="n9130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi> collyrium, <hi rend="ital">tent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pessary</hi>, etc., Macer. 4, 12.</sense></entryFree>
collyris: <entryFree id="n9131" type="greek" key="colly_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">collȳris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">collȳrĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lev. 8, 26</bibl>; cf.: cassida, chlamyda, etc.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kolluri/s</foreign>. <sense id="n9131.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a roll</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Gen. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Gen. 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 7, 12</bibl> (transl. of the Heb. <foreign />).—</sense><sense id="n9131.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9131.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A head-dress of women</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9131.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> malva erratica, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
